strIntroduction: Spend the day at a local home in Okinawa to experience everyday Japanese culture and life! This is a rare opportunity to meet a local family and enjoy some local traditions of Okinawa. Schedule: 10:00am - We'll meet in Motobu in Okinawa, at a local primary school called Kenken-Bunkou. The local family will take you to their home. The family's grandpa and grandma, locally called an "ojii" and "obaa," will teach you how to play the sanshin. The sanshin is a 3-stringed Okinawan musical instrument. You'll be able to relax and enjoy the scenic view of the sea from the porch while you strum the sanshin and learn to play a song! Lunchtime: The family will teach you how to make Okinawasoba, a traditional noodle soup distinct to Okinawa. For dessert, you'll learn how to make sata andagi, a local deep-fried doughnut. After feasting, make sure you don't forget to write down the recipes for an invaluable souvenir to take home! After lunch, relax on the porch and play the sanshin or just enjoy the view from the porch. 3:00pm - You'd love to stay, but it's time to going back. You'll be dropped back off at the primary school, Kenken-Bunkou. After spending the day at the local Okinawan home, Okinawa will be your second home. How about visiting again when you come back to Okinawa?
strTitle: Make Okinawa soba and Learn Sanshin at Local Home in Okinawa

strIntroduction: Nowadays, Japanese people rarely wear kimono due to modernization. However, as traditional clothing, kimono will provide you with an unforgettable, cultural experience in Japan. The kimono studio is located near many historical sites in Nara. The owner is a friendly and experienced woman who wears kimono 300 days a year. You can select your kimono from a choice of about 100 kimono, and the owner will advise you how to make the best combination among the choices. She is an expert in dressing both men and women in kimono so the kimono fits properly. Due to her extensive experience, she is also skilled in beautifully tying the traditional obi belt. The Tour Schedule: 1. Pick-up: I will meet you at a designated place, either a train station or your hotel in Nara. 2. Walk to the Kimono studio: I will begin to give you a brief overview of the traditions of kimono. 3. Kimono Selection and Dress-up: The experienced owner of the kimono studio will allow you to select your kimono among 100 different designs and colors. She will expertly dress you and adorn you with traditional hair accessories. (This takes about 30 minutes.) 4. Walk around Historical Sites in Nara: As a certified tour guide and a local of Nara, I'll bring you to the best traditional sites in Nara, which are conveniently located near the studio. You'll have the opportunity to take pictures adorned in your kimono with the traditional sites of Nara serving as your backdrop! Here are some historical sites that we can visit during the tour: Kasuga Taisha Shrine - This Shinto Shrine is beautifully-restored and registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Nara Park - The park has hundreds of free roaming deer that are both peaceful and considered sacred messengers of the Shinto gods. Kofukuji Temple - Established in 710, the temple is home to the famous five story pagoda that serves as both a landmark and symbol of Nara. Daijoin Garden - This beautiful garden has a tea room and pond. Yuga Shrine - The shrine is one of the many Shinto shrines in the area. There are also antique kimono stores where you can buy a kimono to bring home. If you want a coffee break, there are cozy machiya (traditional town housing) style cafes nearby as well!
strTitle: Walk Around Nara in a Kimono

strIntroduction: Naha is the capital and largest city of Okinawa prefecture. More than just a transportation hub to the beautiful coral-reef islands, Naha has a rich historical heritage and this city tour will introduce all the best sightseeing spots to you. Here is a list of suggested places for this tour. Your guide can take you to other places too upon request: - Shuri Castle. This UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site was originally built in the 14th century as the main residence of the Ryukyu Kingdom (which ruled over Okinawa until the 19th century). Unlike other castles in Japan Shuri has a distinct China-influenced architecture and atmosphere. - Tamaudun Mausoleum. Located close to the Shuri Castle, this mausoleum served as the family tomb for the Ryukyu royal family. The tradition in Okinawa is to erect large stone tombs over graves which is different than in other parts of Japan. - Shikinaen Garden. Another residence of the Ryukyu Kingdom and currently a reconstructed Okinawa-style garden. Visitors can walk around the little pond and enter the wooden residence building. - Okinawa Prefectural Museum. This large museum exhibits many interesting items related to Okinawa's history, traditions and local arts. You will easily immerse yourself in the world of Ryukyu Kingdom. - Japanese Navy Underground Headquarters. This is an impressive 450-long underground tunnel which served as the headquarters of the Japanese Navy during the World War II. Today it stands as one of Okinawa's many memorials to the war victims. - Kokusai Street and Tsuboya District. The main shopping street in Naha attracts with plenty of restaurants, souvenir shops, bars and fresh food markets. Just outside the bustling area is Tsuboya district where you can see many craftsmen shops specializing in Okinawa's famous pottery. This tour can be customized according to your request, so feel free to suggest what else you want to see.
strTitle: See all the best historical sites of Naha, Okinawa

strIntroduction: Hakodate is one of the most charming towns in Hokkaido. Located at the south of the island, it was the first harbor opened to international traders and missionaries after the end of the shogunate in the 19th century. Plenty of Western merchants and officials built their residences and churches here which changed the image of the town and created a peculiar international atmosphere. You can choose between a full day and a half day guided tour in Hakodate. The town is conveniently located to other popular destinations in Hokkaido such as Matsumae, Yunokawa Onsen and Onuma Park, so you are free to decide how much time to spend in the town and how to combine the sightseeing with a visit to nearby places. This is the example itinerary for a half day tour (morning or afternoon): 1. Morning Market or Red Brick Warehouses. The Morning Market is open only until noon and here you can find plenty of fresh seafood (particularly Hokkaido crab) and local fruits such as melons. You can have a quick snack at some of the restaurants or buy something and eat as you walk. The Red Brick Warehouses remain as a historical memory from the early days of Hakodate's opening as an international port. Now the impressive buildings host restaurants, shops and even a wedding chapel. 2. Motomachi area. After Hakodate's opening foreign merchants and missionaries built their residences and churches over the charming slopes of this area. Located just under Mt Hakodate, this pleasant district will fascinate you with its historical and cultural legacy. Here you can find the impressive classical buildings of the Old British Consulate, the Old Public Hall of Hakodate, and the Russian Orthodox Church which is the oldest Orthodox Church in Japan. 3. Mt Hakodate. The night view over Hakodate from the 334-meter tall mountain is considered one of Japan's three best night views (the others being Kobe and Nagasaki). You will be impressed by the stunning view over the town and the entire peninsula. A full day tour in Hokkaido will include all of the above plus: 4. Fort Goryokaku. Largely considered one of Hakodate's symbols, this unique star-shaped citadel cannot be compared to any other fortress in Japan. It was built at the end of the shogunate as a defence facility against the imperialist government. You can see the impressive citadel and the surrounding park from the observatory deck of the Goryokaku Tower located just next to the citadel. 5. Trappistine Convent. This impressive Baroque-style building is a nunnery constructed in 1898 to be the home of several nuns dispatched from Trappistine Monastery in France. The convent is not open for visitors, but you can take a walk around its beautiful garden and see the solemn statues of Virgin Mary and St Michael. The local nuns produce delicious sweets that you can buy at the convent's shop.
strTitle: See the beauty of the international harbor town Hakodate

strIntroduction: Participate in this tour to enjoy a private journey from Sapporo City to Otaru town in Hokkaido! This tour includes English-speaking driver and private transportation services, which will take you to Otaru's best sightseeing spots and to Hokkaido's best whisky distillery! Otaru town developed as the main harbor and trade center of Hokkaido during the first years of the island's reclamation. Many beautiful warehouses along the quaint canal area remain and remind visitors about the town's role in the 19th century. Nowadays many of the historical buildings have been turned into attractive shops, craftsmen ateliers and pleasant cafes. Otaru also hosts the annual Festival of the Snow and the Candles which coincides with Sapporo's Snow Festival in February. A night visit to Otaru during the festival is considered one of the most romantic experiences in Japan. This journey will start in Otaru, where you will have the time to stroll around for 2 hours and a half, so make sure that you explore its attractive shops, ateliers, and unique cafes there. Also have a splendid lunch in Otaru with its delicious gourmet! After that, you will be visiting Nikka Whisky Yoichi Distillery for an hour. Nikka Whisky is one of the most famous Whisky brand in Japan, and Yoichi Distillery is famous for its house brand: Nikka Yoichi Whisky. Yoichi distillery is Nikka Whisky's first distillery, which was established in 1934. These days, Yoichi distillery mainly works for distilling and bottling the whisky. After visiting the distillery, you will be visiting one of the most panoramic flower gardens in Hokkaido: Shikisai-no-oka, for 30 minutes before returning to Sapporo City. The flower garden is a paradise of seasonal flowers from spring to fall, consisting several dozens species of flowers and grasses. The itinerary for this tour is as follows: - Depart from Sapporo City (within 8:00-10:00) - Visit Otaru Town and stay there for 2 hours and a half - Visit Nikka Whisky Yoichi Distillery for an hour - Visit Shikisai-no-oka Flower Garden for 30 minutes - Return to Sapporo City (ETA: 14:00-16:00) Join this tour and explore the beauty of Otaru town, visit one of the most famous distilleries in Hokkaido, and enjoy the breathtaking view of seasonal flowers at Shikisai-no-oka!
strTitle: Day Trip to Otaru from Sapporo with Private Transportation!

strIntroduction: After the end of the shogunate the Meiji government began Hokkaido's reclamation and development. The expansion to the north resulted in the quick modernization of Sapporo city. Foreign architects, designers and experts were invited to help for the city's development and that explains the rectangular street network and the abundance of Western-style buildings. This one day tour will start from Sapporo Station (or your hotel) and will take you to some of the best historical highlights related to Hokkaido's reclamation and Sapporo's development at the end of the 19th century. You will visit the following places: - the Historical Village of Hokkaido, a fantastic open-air museum which exhibits many historical buildings related to Hokkaido's reclamation. Here you will immerse yourself in the world of 19th century and will even have the chance to ride a horse-drawn trolley! - the Clock Tower, Sapporo's main symbol. The building was designed in 1878 as a drill hall for the local Agricultural College and fascinates with its simple American Midwest atmosphere. It stands as an important cultural asset and a legacy of the foreign influence in Hokkaido's development. - the Former Hokkaido Government Office, a beautiful red-brick building with an octagonal dome on the top. Currently it hosts museum exhibits and various events. - Odori Park and Sapporo TV Tower. The longest 1.5-kilometer park is the main venue of the annual International Snow Festival held in Sapporo every February. In summer this park holds summer festivals and beer gardens. You can get a great view over the park and the city from the observatory deck of Sapporo's TV Tower. - Sapporo Beer Museum. Sapporo Beer is an internationally famous beer brand which was first brewed in Sapporo in 1877. This museum is located in a splendid red-brick building and exhibits the history of the beer brewing in Japan. Of course, you can savor the local beer in the nearby Beer Garden! At the end of this tour you will have learned a lot about the fascinating history of the city and the island's reclamation.
strTitle: Discover the fascinating historical legacy of Sapporo

strIntroduction: Sapporo is Japan's fifth largest city and the capital of Hokkaido prefecture. The city has a strong Western feel thanks to its architecture and landscape planning which are influenced by Western examples. In 1972 Sapporo hosted the first Winter Olympics in Japan and you can still see some of the top-class facilities at the hills and mountains which surround the city. Sapporo also hosts the International Snow Festival every February and attracts plenty of local and international visitors. The city is also best known as the home of the chocolate factory Ishiya and the popular Sapporo beer. This one-day guided tour will take you to some of Sapporo's highlights. Your walk will start from Sapporo Station (or your hotel) and will continue to the following places: - the Former Hokkaido Government Office, a national important cultural property. This beautiful red brick building and its octagonal dome on the top symbolize the cultivation and development of Hokkaido island. - the famous Clock Tower, Sapporo's best known symbol. Initially the building was designed as a drill hall of the local Agricultural College in 1878. Now it fascinates with its simple Western (American Midwest) design and evokes the memories of Hokkaido's development at the end of the 19th century. - Odori Park, the longest park in Sapporo and the venue of the annual Snow Festival. In summer Odori Park hosts summer festivals, beer gardens and bon-odori Japanese dance events. - Maruyama Park and Hokkaido Jingu Shrine. This spacious natural park is used for relaxing picnics, sports and entertainment. It's also the home of Sapporo's zoo. Hokkaido Jingu Shrine is an impressive Shinto shrine built to enshrine the deities which protect Hokkaido's reclamation. - Okurayama Ski Jump Hill. A former Olympic facility which now provides fantastic panoramic views over the entire city. - Sapporo Chocolate Factory. This large facility is managed by Ishiya, the chocolate factory which produces the famous local sweets "Shiroi no Koibito" ("White Lovers"). Here you can observe the production process, see various exhibits and buy top-class sweets for souvenirs. Hokkaido's sweets are considered some of the best in Japan! Don't forget to try also Sapporo's local specialty, ramen noodles! This tour will show you the best of Sapporo no matter which season you visit the city in.
strTitle: Explore Sapporo's highlights in a day tour

strIntroduction: This is a special tour in which you will experience having a dinner with a typical family in Okinawa, Japan. This is a great opportunity to cook homemade dishes, have dinner with us and learn more about the local food culture of Okinawa and Japan. We offer special experiences which you can't have in other types of travel such as group tours. This is a special activity in which you will come into contact with the culture of Okinawa, Japan. This activity is offered between January and September (except on New Year, Obon, Lunar Obon). The suggested schedule is as follows: Pick up from your hotel (around 17:00) -> Go to a typical private house, cook a meal together and have fun eating with us(About 3 hours) -> Take you back to your hotel (around a little past 20:00) Note: Limited to hotels in Nago or Motobu areas.
strTitle: Spend the evening having a dinner with a family in Okinawa

strIntroduction: Please come to the following place directly by a rental car or taxi: Nago city office Haniji branch office (10:00 am) First, I will take you to the sugarcane field. You will try the challenge of harvesting and experiencing the daily work of the local farmers. Help your host by cutting as much as you can! Then we'll go my farmhouse where we'll eat Okinawa soba for lunch together! We'll let you know the recipe so that you can do it yourself next time. After lunch we'll go back to the sugarcane field and continue harvesting. Your skills will be greatly improved and you'll enjoy the work! Just about when you're already completely used to the harvesting it's time to end the experience (around 15:00). Have unforgettable moments in a rural farmhouse with locals in Okinawa, Japan! This experience is offered between January 20 and February 28.
strTitle: Harvest sugarcane and make Okinawa soba during a home visit

strIntroduction: How do you like Japan's food culture? The food culture is different than in other countries and these differences also appear in the school lunch. Japanese school lunch is healthy and nutritionally well-balanced. Surprisingly, there are some restaurants which offer a typical school lunch! The interior looks just like a Japanese class room, so you will feel as if you are in a real Japanese high school! The menu: *Regular Menu - noodle lunch - curry lunch *Daily Special Menu (one of four sets) - yakisoba lunch - pork beans lunch - boiled hamburger steak lunch - rice with hashed meat lunch * All lunch sets have a bottle of milk and a dessert. * You can additionally order other dishes, drinks, or desserts. Here is an example of the schedule for this activity: 11:00 - Meet at Shimizu Station 11:15 - Take a bus to the restaurant 11:30 - Have a Japanese school lunch and chat with us 12:30 - Take a fun photo sticker! ( It's called "Purikura") 13:00 - End of tour
strTitle: Have a Japanese school lunch with locals in Shizuoka!

strIntroduction: Japanese strawberry mochi rice cakes called "ichigo daifuku" are a popular local sweet. A whole strawberry is wrapped in red bean paste (but we can put cream instead) and rice cake. It's going to melt in your mouth! In this activity we will take you to a Japanese house and will assist you in making your own mochi rice cake that you can eat with green tea. We also recommend another strawberry-related activity: picking and eating as many strawberries as you like! Here is an example schedule for this activity: 13:00 - Meet at Shizuoka Station and go to my house 13:40 - Make strawberry mochi rice cakes 14:10 - Eat the strawberry mochi rice cakes with green tea 15:00 - End of the activity
strTitle: Make your own strawberry mochi rice cake!

strIntroduction: We are going to an amusement facility in Shizuoka, where we will introduce to you various attractions. If you want to experience the real life of young Japanese people, you should try these activities. Because few people of the amusement facilities staff speak English and read signs written in English, we think it is difficult for foreigners to have a great time at such places in Japan. Therefore we're pleased to help you enjoy your time! Some of the attractions we will try are bowling, "Purikura" fun photos and a game arcade including a machine with taiko drums!
strTitle: Have fun with young Japanese people and their youth culture!

strIntroduction: In this activity you will come to my house in Kanzaki-gun region in Hyogo prefecture (about 40 minutes by limited express train from Himeji Station) and I will teach you to make your own Shodo calligraphy art works. You will have the opportunity to write your name or any other characters on souvenir items that you choose. After the class you can take your own original work with you. You can choose between practicing calligraphy on: - Washi (Japanese paper) - Sensu (folding fan made of paper on a bamboo frame)
strTitle: Try Japanese calligraphy Shodo!

strIntroduction: In this special tour, you can spend time with an ordinary family in Okinawa and experience the farming lifestyle of Okinawan people for a day. At the same time, it will be possible to learn Japanese and Okinawan cultures. - The availability of the event From the beginning of January to the end of September (Excluding Lunar New Year, Obon and Lunar Obon festivals) - Minimum number of participants 1 - Tour guide No tour guide - Place to meet Hotels in Nago city or Motobu town. It is also possible to meet at the roadside station of Kyoda ("Kyoda Michi no Eki") in Nago city or YANBARU sea station in Motobu town. - Duration time About 5 hours - Schedule Meeting place (around 10:00)==Go to an ordinary family home (help the father's family business, pineapple harvesting and rice making, and cook home-made food)==Back to the place where we met (Around 15:00)
strTitle: Experience daily life with an ordinary Okinawa family

strIntroduction: Himeji Castle is located in Hyogo prefecture, just an hour away by train from Osaka. The city is best known for its picturesque Himeji Castle, widely considered one of the three best castles in Japan (others being Kumamoto and Nagoya Castles). It was built in 1609, during the first years of the Edo period, and is currently one of the very few castles in Japan which survived through fires, earthquakes, wars without ever being destroyed. Due to its well-preserved shape and cultural legacy, Himeji Castle was one of the first places in Japan to be announced a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site in 1993. The castle was recently renovated in long-running renovation works which spanned for 5 years and caused the entire building to be covered completely by a scaffold structure. Minor construction works of the interior continue until Himeji Castle's grand reopening on March 27, 2015. The castle will once again impress visitors with its beautiful building surrounded by plenty of blossoming sakura cherry trees. This half-day guided tour will begin at 9:00 (for the morning tour option) or at 13:00 (for the afternoon tour option) at JR Himeji Station which can be easily reached by an one-hour JR train from Osaka Station or a 90-minute direct train from Kyoto Station. Alternatively, you can reach Himeji in about 30 minutes with the Shinkansen bullet train. Your guide will show you around Himeji Castle and the beautiful park. Another interesting place you will visit is the Kokoen Garden, located just beside the castle. This Japanese-style garden is relatively new, constructed in 1992 on the grounds of a former samurai residence. It has a picturesque pond, waterfalls, flower gardens and a tea room where you can try good-quality green tea. Optional: You can also choose to book the additional option of a visit to Mt Shosha's scenic Engyoji Temple located in the hills near Himeji city. This old temple impresses with its traditional atmosphere, beautiful wild nature and lack of any modern facilities which makes it a popular choice as a filming location. The famous Hollywood movie "The Last Samurai" was also shot here.
strTitle: See the renovated UNESCO World Heritage Himeji Castle!

strIntroduction: Kobe is a city with so many faces! One of the many great ways to enjoy Kobe is to have a pleasant and relaxed walk along the waterfront port area in the evening. The view of the city at night is named "a 10-million-dollar" view and is one of Japan's three best night views, together with Nagasaki and Hakodate. Kobe is also known for its high-quality juicy beef which you can try in a top-rated award-winning restaurant. This is the ultimate tour for people who seek romantic and relaxed experiences! Your tour will start at 17:00 in the afternoon at JR Kobe Station (about 25 minutes away by train from Osaka Station). Your guide will show you around Kobe Harborland, a modern and attractive waterfront area with plenty of shops, cafes and seaside promenades with charming old-fashioned gas lamps. Then your guide will take you to a top-rated and award-winning restaurant where you can savour a delicious Kobe beef menu. You'll be surprised by how soft and juicy it is! After dinner your guide will take you to some great spots from where you can see the amazing night view of Kobe city and quietly enjoy the evening. The tour will end at JR Shin-Kobe Station or JR Sannomiya Station, where you guide will explain to you how to reach your hotel. Note: Dinner is not included in the price. Please pay in cash at the restaurant. The price of the meal will be 10 000 JPY or higher per person.
strTitle: Enjoy Kobe beef and a "10-million-dollar night view"!

strIntroduction: In this guided tour you will visit the little hot spring town Arima Onsen, located on the opposite side of Mt Rokko, next to Kobe city. Arima Onsen is widely accepted as one of the best and most atmospheric hot spring towns in Japan. Here you can taste the old traditional flavour of a hot spring resort and have a pleasant walk around the little streets. The town has a history of over 1000 years and still preserves the spirit of the old times. Seeing guests of the local inns strolling around in yukata (a light kimono) is a common sight. In this tour you will also have the chance to try the high-quality water of the local hot springs! Your tour will start at 9:00 am at Namba station in Osaka or at Osaka Station (for people arriving from Kyoto). You will go directly to Arima Onsen and will have a pleasant walk along the river flowing through the center of the town. The first interesting spot is the statues of the Arima Onsen patrons from the 16th century. You will visit a local bamboo crafts shop and learn more about the local tradition of bamboo crafting. Nearby is an interesting temple where people pray for health recovery. At Taiko no Yu museum you will learn more about the traditions and history of Arima Onsen, and you will see some good-quality baths. Finally, you will have the chance to soak your feet in the footbath at Kin no Yu public bath. Arima Onsen has two major hot spring - one called "Golden water" because of the brown colour of the water which contains iron, and another one called "Silver water" which is clear. Both have a very positive effect on the body. Your tour will end with a return back to Osaka Station and with lots of memories from the splendid little hot spring town!
strTitle: Walk around the splendid hot spring town Arima Onsen

strIntroduction: In this tour you will visit the UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site of Horyuji Temple in Nara. Your professional guide will show you around the spacious temple complex. You will see the world's oldest existing wooden structures and will learn many interesting things about the history of Buddhism in Japan. Plenty of national treasures and art products are exhibited in Horyuji. The temple complex is divided to a Western Precinct, where you can see the Main Hall, the five-storey pagoda and the inner gate - the oldest wooden structures in the world, dating back to the early 7th century. Prince Shotoku Taishi built Horyuji Temple as part of his initiative of introducing Buddhism in Japan. In the Great Treasury you can see interesting exhibits related to the history of the temple and the distribution of Buddhism in Japan. The Eastern Precinct is the home of the Octagonal Hall where you can see a huge statue of a Healing Buddha. Next to the hall you will see a very old belfry. There are many other interesting spots around the temple and you will be fascinated by the strong historical impact of Horyuji.
strTitle: Explore the UNESCO World Heritage of Horyuji Temple in Nara

strIntroduction: This is an English Babysitting/Cultural Tutoring service for travelers! <What We do> We introduce bilingual babysitters and home teachers for kids from the age of one year old. We take care of your children and also teach Japanese language and culture by playing traditional games. <For Who> - Who needs English babysitting during dinner/lunch time. - Who wants their children to experience Japanese culture. <About Staffs> All of our babysitters/tutors are English-Japanese bilinguals who have lived in English speaking countries for more than 3 years when they were kids. We take care of your children at your hotel.
strTitle: English Babysitting/Tutoring during your travel Tokyo

strIntroduction: Explore the places in Chichibu and Hanno cities (Saitama prefecture, north of Tokyo) where the wonderful Japanese anime "Anohana" and "Yamanosusume" were staged. We will take you to some popular spots featured in the anime such as Tenranzan , Ginza Shotengai, Chichibu Bridge etc. We can also take you to other places in the region upon your request! Here is an example of this tour's itinerary: 9:00 Tokyo Station 10:30 Hanno Station 11:00 "Yamanosusume" anime time Tenranzan (Local Japanese sake shopping) Hannogawara Ginza Shotengai shopping street +Lunch Time 15:00 "Anohana" anime time Chichibu Bridge Any other places in the area 17:30 Seibu-Chichibu Station
strTitle: Visit the real spots from anime "Anohana" & "Yamanomusume"

strIntroduction: This tour includes a private English-speaking guide and transportation with taxi for your comfort. Have a relaxed one-day trip around Osaka's highlights! The tour begins at 9:00 am at Namba station Osaka (within 30 minutes distance from JR Osaka Station). First, the tour will take you to Sumiyoshi Taisha Shrine in southern Osaka. This is the head of all Sumiyoshi shrines in Japan which enshrine the deities protecting travelers and sailors. You will see a peculiar architectural style that is unique to Japan and has no influence from the rest of Asia. Sumiyoshi Taisha Shrine is a popular spot to visit and pray during New Year. Next, you will go to Shitennoji Temple, one of the oldest Buddhist temples in Japan. Built by Prince Shotoku Taishi in the 6th century, this temple fascinates with its tall pagoda and beautiful Buddhist garden. For lunch you will stroll the Shinsekai shopping streets where you will find plenty of little restaurants and food stalls. This is one of the liveliest shopping areas and has a strong Asian atmosphere. One of the landmarks here is Tsutenkaku Tower. The local delicacies include takoyaki (octopus dumplings) and kushi-katsu (fried food on a stick). Your tour will continue to Osaka Castle, one of the biggest and most beautiful castles in Japan. It was built in late 16th century and has been reconstructed many times until its present form. The spacious garden around the castle is one of the best places to enjoy sakura blossoms. Finally, you will go to Umeda Sky Building where you can see Osaka from a bird's view at the floating garden which connects the two skyscrapers at the top floors, 173 meters above the ground. This tour will show you the best of Osaka in a day!
strTitle: Explore Osaka in a private taxi day tour!

strIntroduction: In this guided tour you will first visit the Tofukuji Temple complex south of Kyoto Station. It's an important Zen temple built in the 13th century and is known as one of the best autumn colours sightseeing spots in Kyoto. You will be impressed not only by the architecture and the giant Sanmon gate, but also by the unique Zen rock gardens created by Japan's famous landscape architect Mirei Shigemori. You will then go to Shorinji, one of the sub-temples of Tofukuji, where you will participate in a Zed meditation practice for about an hour (it includes also introduction of the temple by a local priest and tea at the end of the practice). This is a unique opportunity to relax and forget about the everyday stress. Finally, your guide will take you to the impressive Fushimi Inari Shrine - the head of all Inari shrines in Japan. It's fascinating with the hundreds of vermilion gates going up the mountain into the forest. This is one of the best half-day tours to experience the true spirit of Kyoto!
strTitle: Experience Zen meditation and see eminent Kyoto temples

strIntroduction: "Machiya" are traditional townhouses in downtown Kyoto which have specific authentic atmosphere. This tour gives you the opportunity to explore the charming little streets of Kyoto and find unique places that carry the old spirit of Japan. Furthermore, you can stroll around dressed in kimono! Your guide will take you to several old Machiya townhouses such as Kayo (where you can rent kimono for 3000 JPY), Mumeisha Yoshida (which used to be the shop and residence of a wealthy local merchant) and Kinshi Masamune sake brewery. You will also have the chance to stroll the picturesque Teramachi Street and enjoy the quaint flavour of Kyoto's Machiya district. This half-day tour is ideal for those who want to discover the heart of Kyoto's downtown area and learn more about the traditional lifestyle of the local people. Start Time: 13:00 End Time: 17:00
strTitle: Explore the traditional Machiya houses in Kyoto

strIntroduction: You can try both Kimono and Japanese traditional dance in just 2 hours!! Here is what this activity includes: 1. Receive a brief overview of what Kimono and traditional Japanese dances are like. 2. Get dressed in Kimono. You can choose one from our large selection. You will sense a touch which is different than the one of western clothes and you may feel that your back straightens up naturally when you are dressed in Kimono. 3. Learn some basic walking manners while you are dressed in Kimono. Standing up, sitting down...you have never moved in such ways. 4. Learn Japanese traditional dance. You will be dancing to the tune of "Sakura Sakura (Cherry blossoms)", one of the most popular traditional Japanese song. You can master the dance during the lesson. 5. Take commemorative photos posing nicely in Kimono and you will become a Kimono Beauty or a Kimono Handsome! The place of the class is in Iwate.
strTitle: Discover Japan with Kimono and Japanese traditional dances

strIntroduction: Izu Peninsula in Shizuoka prefecture is one of Japan's best resorts and a top destination for many people in Tokyo who wish to have a day trip or a 1-night stay. It is famous for good-quality hot springs, delicious seafood and wonderful nature. One of the highlights of Izu in early spring is the Kawazu Sakura Festival which takes place in February and March. Kawazu Sakura is a species of cherry trees which blossoms earlier than the other ones (usually around late February and early March). It's spectacular with its rich pink colour and is especially picturesque along rivers in open nature. In this self-guided day trip to Izu you will visit one of the main places of the Kawazu Sakura Festivals and see the first blossoming cherry trees in Japan! You'll be amazed by their beauty and impressed by the nature of Izu. You can have lunch at a nearby resort hotel - a traditional Japanese meal! Take the Odoriko or Super Odoriko View limited express train from JR Tokyo Station at 9:00, 10:00 or 11:00 (also 10:30 in weekends), and get off at Kawazu Station. The Kawazu Sakura cherry trees are located along the river for about 4 kilometers starting from the station. After arriving, take the shuttle bus to Izu Imaihama Tokyu Resort from bus stop 1 of Kawazu Staton. The buses run under the following schedule until March 11 (and fewer buses after that); Kawazu Station to the Resort: every 10-15 minutes from 11:00 to 14:00 The Resort to Kawazu Station: every 10-15 minutes from 12:00 to 15:30 You can choose between a traditional Japanese lunch (available any day) or a Western style buffet (available between February 13 and March 6). The lunch time is 11:30 to 14:00. Finally, you will take the Odoriko or Super Odoriko View limited express train back to Tokyo (last train at 17:06). The trip takes a little more than 2 hours one way.
strTitle: See beautiful early sakura in Izu in February and March!

strIntroduction: Come to my house and learn how to make Japanese food near Shibuya, Tokyo! STEP1 Cook Japanese photogenic food and Japanese sweets. === Menu example=== 1.Temarizushi This is a ball-shaped sushi made by pressing rice and fish into a ball-shaped form by hand using a plastic wrap. 2.Dorayaki This is two small pancakes with bean jam in between them. STEP2 Whisked powdered green tea. STEP3 Eat Japanese food and talk with Japanese ladies. This experience will help you get to know the Japanese food and culture better in a private home environment! So feel free to come, relax and have fun learning to cook Japanese food! I am looking forward to seeing you!
strTitle: Learn how to make Japanese photogenic food

strIntroduction: <Half Day course> JR Line Nara Station Omiwa ShrineHasedera TempleKintetsu Line Nara station We will meet at the JR Nara Station. Then take the local JR Manyo Mahoroba line that runs only 1 or 2 "one-man" trains every hour for about 30 minutes and get off at Miwa Station. The railway runs along the Yamanobe-no-michi, said to be the oldest road of Japan, where many historical sites and monuments can be found, and you can enjoy the view of Japan's countryside with its rice fields. From Miwa Station we will arrive to the Shinto "torii" gateway of Omiwa Shrine after about a 10 minutes walk. During the trip, I will tell you about the history of Japan, about Shinto, origin and legends of Omiwa Shrine, as well as the basic manners related to worshipping Shinto gods in shrines. Please feel free to ask any questions about anything. Omiwa Shrine It is also called Miwa myojin, and is said to be the oldest shrine in Japan. Miwa mountain is an object of worship and is believed to to be sacred as the deity Omononushi no Kami placed his soul in it. He has been worshiped as the guardian of peoples lives in general; prosperity and development of agriculture, industries and commerce, healing and medicine, safety, safe traveling, successful marriages, as well as happiness in the world. Many legends and stories have been written and passed down many generations throughout the centuries, and many dedicated believers across the nation visit this shrine on various occasions. Plenty of rituals and prayers, annual events, marriage ceremonies in traditional styles are held here. Recently, Miwa mountain has been gaining popularity as one of the leading power energy spots in Japan. It has a waterfall, old Japanese cedars and sacred rocks calle iwakura where gods are said to dwell. In Sai Shrine, 5 minutes walk from the Omiwa shrine, you can drink pure spring water, which is believed to cure all kinds of diseases, and anyone can drink from the well. From the nearby observatory, you can have a great view of Yamato area, including Yamato's three mountains, the Hashihaka tumulus which is said to be Japans oldest, and believed to be the tomb of Himiko, a legendary shaman queen of Yamato. After leaving the Omiwa Shrine, we will visit Hasedera Temple by Kintestu railway, 2 stops away from Sakurai Station. From the train station, we will walk through the old Pilgrimage routes now filled with with traditional inns and souvenir shops until we reach Niou gate, the entrance of Hasedera Temple. Along the way, we will taste the popular "kusa mochi", a traditional Japanese sweet made from mochi rice with leaves of Japanese Mugwort (yomogi), filled with sweet red bean paste. Hasedera Temple Surrounded by mountains in all directions, Hasedera Temple is especially popular due to its seasonal beauty. The best time of the year is in spring, when sakura (cherry blossoms) and Chinese peonies are fully blooming. Autumn is another beautiful time with many maple trees turning to stunning red. As the temples is located on the slope of mountain, we will climb up the trail to get to the main hall. Some of the many important cultural properties include the main hall and the main statue, the Eleven Faced Kannnon, or the Goddess of Mercy of 9.3 meters, said to be the largest wooden statue in Japan. The stage of the main hall is similar to that of the famous Kiyomizu Temple in Kyoto, and has an amazing view! Why dont you get a beautiful Shuin (), or a seal stamp of the temple, hand written by a priest or special staff with an ink brush just in front of you. -------------------------------- <One Day Course> After finishing the half-day course, we will take another train to Murou-guchi-Oono, and visit Murouji Temple and Murou Ryuketsu Temple. Murouji Temple This temple is a Buddhist temple of Shingon school, located between Nara and Mie prefectures deep in the nature. Murouji has been called Nyonin-Koya (Mt Koya for women), since it has allowed women to enter, while the famous Mount Koya in Wakayama Prefecture never permitted women to visit and become nuns. You will walk up many stone steps to reach the symbolic, charming five-storey pagoda. Many old Buddhist statues are also featured in this temple. Murou Ryuketsu Temple It is close to Murouji Temple, but further up the mountain. This temple worships Ryujin, or Dragon god, who's in charge of water and rain. From ancient times Imperial envoys were sent to this sacred site to do special rituals and prayers for rain. You will see many tall old Japanese cedars powerfully standing in the temple grounds. You will also have access to a rocky mountain with a cave, believed to be the Dragon god's dwelling. This is a power energy spot to which not everyone has access. We will take a taxi to the train station and come back to Nara by Kintesu Railway.
strTitle: Visit deep spiritual sites in Nara with a local guide!

strIntroduction: In this private guided tour you will visit Omiya - the center of Saitama prefecture which lies just 30 minutes away north of Tokyo. Your first stop will be the unique Omiya Bonsai Museum where you will learn a lot of interesting facts about the tradition and culture of making bonsai in Japan. Saitama will host the World Bonsai Convention in 2017 and you will be surprised to find many private bonsai gardens scattered around the city. Next you will visit the grand Railway Museum where you will enjoy an impressive display of real-size trains from various historical periods. There are so many things to do there that you will want to spend a whole day inside! Enjoy the attractions of Saitama city in this pleasant day trip from Tokyo!
strTitle: Visit the Bonsai Museum and Railway Museum in Omiya, Saitama

strIntroduction: There's a reason why Tokyo is known as the city with 100 different faces! Here you can literally find everything. This special one day tour guarantees that you will see both the past, the present and the future of one of the world's liveliest cities. The boat trip between Asakusa and Odaiba will feel like a time machine and you will fully enjoy the nice contrast. This tour starts at Asakusa, where you will visit the oldest temple in Tokyo - Sensoji - and learn more about the history of the neighbourhood from your guide. The charming shopping streets around Asakusa provide a fantastic opportunity to do you souvenir shopping. Here you can find absolutely everything - Japanese pictures, scrolls, fans, sweets, even swords and kimonos! From Asakusa you'll have a splendid view to Tokyo Sky Tree - it's the perfect distance for making good-quality photos. After lunch you will take the water bus down the Sumida River and will reach the artificial island of Odaiba in Tokyo Bay. The entire place looks totally different and is always vibrant at any time. Your tour will finish at the popular shopping center Palette Town where you'll visit the romantic Venice-like mall Venus Fort, Toyota's exhibition center Mega Web and finally you'll ride the giant Ferris Wheel to enjoy a wonderful panorama view over Tokyo. Pick-up service is available from hotels in central Tokyo by booking the hotel pickup option.
strTitle: Discover Tokyo from past to future: Asakusa to Odaiba tour

strIntroduction: A sea angel is a tiny and cute ice creature. Let's walk along the coastline of Okhotsk Sea in Hokkaido and try to find sea angels in the icy water. If we are lucky, we will find some, and we will also enjoy the beautiful scenery and sound of the clashing ice blocks. Here is a model itinerary: 7:00am Pick you up at the accommodation 7:00am to 7:30am Walk along the sea coast 8:00 am Return to your accommodation. This activity is held from January to March, any day in the morning. I drive a small car, maximum person is four including the driver. This car is a typical Japanese kei car and you can experience Japanese technology. It would be good if you can prepare a pair of water proof rubber boots - you can ask for a pair at your accommodation. I am sorry but I can not guarantee that we will find sea angels. It depends on the climate conditions and other factors.
strTitle: Explore the drift ice of Okhotsk Sea in Hokkaido

strIntroduction: Right next to Memanbetsu Aiport, north-east Hokkaido, there is a farmland which is more than 100 years old. It's been owned by 3 generations of farmers. Here you can try the unique experience of becoming a farmer while watching the airplanes, the white birch trees, and beautiful countryside. This farmland has a beautiful countryside scenery and many visitors from all over the world come to take pictures here. Now you can become a farmer yourself! There are different farming activities depending on the season: Time: The end of March to the beginning of April. Activities: Preparing for seeding potato. There are five different sizes and the farming work takes place during daytime. Time: May 1st to 5th Activities. Riding a 50-year-old traditional tractor made in Great Britain(UK) and make sure each seed is planted to its right place in the hole. Time: Anytime during the green season Activities: Weeding experience Time: September 15th to the end of September Activities: Harvesting potatoes. The farm and the airport are close to Abashiri city, known for popular sightseeing spots like the drifting ice in Okhotsk Sea and the Northern People Museum.
strTitle: Experience potato farming in northern Hokkaido

strIntroduction: Tomioka Silk Mill was built in the end of the 19th century by the Meiji Government in an attempt to modernize and industrialize Japan's leading textile production. The factory was produced and managed by French merchants and helped in elevating Japan's silk industry to an international level. For many decades until the factory was closed 30 years ago Japan was one of the world's biggest producers of silk. Tomioka Silk Mill was designed as a UNESCO World Cultural Heritate Site in 2014 for its outstanding role in Japan's modernization and industrialization. In this self-guided tour you will go to the little town of Tomioka in Gunma prefecture and visit the factory's beautiful brick buildings. You'll be able to see the silk reeling machines and learn more about the specifics of sericulture. Furthermore you'll receive a special coupon for collecting 3 sweets of your choice from local sweet shops around the town! Start your tour from JR Tokyo or Ueno Stations where you'll ride Shinkansen Tanigawa-gou (please note that you cannot take other type of bullet trains). Get off at Takasaki Station and exchange your voucher for the special round trip ticket plus Silk Mill entrance at Joshin Railway's counter. Take the Joshin train to Joshu Tomioka Station, from where the Silk Mill is about 10 minutes away on foot. Regular guided tours around the factory are held in Japanese every 30 minutes, but you can rent an English audio guide for 200 JPY or use a special smartphone application. This tour includes also a voucher for the special "Mayu no Okashibako" coupon that you can receive from the Okatte Market just across Joshu Tomioka Station. You will be given a map of the sweet shops around Tomioka town and you can pick 3 local Japanese sweets of your own choice from selected shops using the coupon! This is a great opportunity to explore freely the picturesque town! Finally, you will return back to Tokyo using Shinkansen Tanigawa-gou. This day trip will provide you with the unique experience of visiting a countryside Japanese town, eating local sweets and seeing the latest UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site! This tour is available every day except Wednesdays (or Thursdays if Wednesday is a national holiday). However, the tour is available on the following Wednesdays: April 29, May 6 and in August.
strTitle: Visit the World Cultural Heritage Tomioka Silk Mill!

strIntroduction: Do you know Japanese local Shopping Street? There are many specialty shops with heartwarming people. While the increasing rate of supermarket has been causing a decline in shopping street, I want to introduce one of the most energetic shopping street. Sunamachi Ginza. Let's walk together and taste Japanese local kitchen! **Points** 1.You can taste delicious & various types of Japanese home-style foods and drinks.(Every food and guide are included in the price.) 2.Experience Japanese culture through walking around with guide. 3.Be part of the local culture! **Details** 11:00 Meet up at Kinshicho Station. Move to Sunamachi Ginza by local bus. 11:30 Eating and walking around in Shopping Street. You can taste many types of foods and drinks. (8 different food to taste from) 14:00 Finish at Kameido station. **What you can taste** -Tempura -Inari sushi -Hard boiled and seasoning egg -Yakitori -Oden -Minced Tuna Cutlet -Sake -Japanese tea and sweets
strTitle: Tokyo FooDrink Tour @ Sunamachi Ginza

strIntroduction: Japan is a country where you can enjoy plenty types of food: sushi,tempura, teriyaki, shabushabu, udon, ramen, okonomiyaki and so on! Japanese food looks and tastes good and unique. Its nice to try eating as many types of Japanese food as you can while staying in Japan, but how about cooking one of them? In this activity, you can learn how to cook Japanese food in an old Japanese-style house. We'll pick you up at Subway Tanimachi 6-chome station on Tanimachi (violet) line. It takes about 5 minutes to walk to the house. You can choose what you would like to cook from those below : 1. Set Meal -Rice -Miso soup -Main dish -Teriyaki -Ginger flavored pork -Grilled fish -Boiled fish -Nikujaga 2. Don (bowl of rice with food on top) -Oyakodon (Chicken and egg) -Katsudon (Fried pork) -Gyudon ( Flavored beef and vegetable) -Tendon (Tempura) 3. Osaka food -Okonomiyaki -Takoyaki -Yakisoba 4. Party style (from 3 persons ) -Sushi -Takoyaki 5. As you request The place is located in Tanimachi, which is one of the traditional residential areas in Osaka city, so you can enjoy walking around the area after you finish the class. Lets enjoy cooking and visiting in an old Japanese house!
strTitle: Cooking class in an old Japanese-style house

strIntroduction: In this activity you can learn how to make your own candy from a professional candy artisan. I'll meet you at JR Shin-Nagata station on Kobe line. We'll walk to the candy workshop (about 10 minutes). There the schedule is as follows: 1. Demonstration by the artisan 2. Point to be noted 3. Practice Knead candy  Create the shape you like You can take the candies back to your home as a souvenir. Lets try making a lovely candy as a sweet memory of Japan !
strTitle: Make a handmade Japanese candy

strIntroduction: We provide you with an occasion to be a part of Japan. You can discover the true Japanese spirit through "Wa" (Japanese) cultural experiences. "Wa" spirit means our Japanese love for peace, harmony and nature. We offer the experience of Japanese home cooking. It's fun and tasty! <Course Schedule> 1. Introduction Introduction of essential knowledge about washoku and its background. 2. Cooking Time Lets cook washoku all together! Dont worry, well show you the demonstration and instruction in detail. 3. Eating Time Now lets try the dishes you made. Enjoy your meal in an 80-year-old Japanese style house.
strTitle: Experience traditional Japanese cooking in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Lets try making Wagashi, Japanese traditional sweets! I'll meet you at JR Tsuruhashi station. And we'll walk to the wagashi factory (10-15minutes). At the factory, a local artisan will show you around the factory, and teach you how to make wagashi. Ingredients are quite simple, mainly rice, adzuki (red) beans and sugar. But the shapes and ingredients are different in each season and area. This time, you can make 2 types of Wagashi. - Ohagi : a rice ball coated with sweetened red beans, soybean flour or sesame - Jou nama gashi : high-grade Japanese fresh confections colorfully made in seasonal shapes and designs You can savour them there with tea or take them back as a souvenir. Please eat them by the next day as they can't stay fresh for too long. Finally, we will walk back to Tsuruhashi station. So lets enjoy a cozy Japanese teatime with your own wagashi!!
strTitle: Learn how to make wagashi - Japanese traditional sweets!

strIntroduction: You can see Osaka city from different angles during the car drive to the buildings. The beautiful city of Osaka is waiting for you. We'll pick you up at your hotel from 7:30 p.m. and arrive 8:00 p.m. at Hommachi-station. Alternatively, we'll meet at exit 20 of Hommachi-station on Yotsubashi-line. This tour takes one hour and half. We'll start'at 8:00 p.m. and continue to 9:30 p.m.. After the tour we'll transport you to your hotel about 10:00 p.m.. Many travelers don't know about the spectacular views from these building. Even if you have any luggage, please feel free to ask and join our tour.
strTitle: Enjoy an Awesome Night View of Osaka City

strIntroduction: Several big countdown concerts will be held in Tokyo in the last hours of 2016. You can choose to attend some of them and welcome the New 2017 Year together with a crowd of music lovers in some of Tokyo's best music halls! Popular Japanese singers, musicians and entertainers will perform for hours and will create a unique atmosphere that you simply have to experience! Below are the details of the countdown concert events: Countdown Japan 16/17 at Makuhari Messe One of the biggest venues will host several days of concerts starting from December 28 and ending with a massive countdown event on the evening of December 31. Japan's best and most famous J-pop and J-rock artists (Kyary Pamyu Pamyu, Kana-Boon, Golden Bomber, Kalafina, Orange Range, Denpagumi.Inc, The Yellow Monkey are just some of the performers) will gather for this unforgettable music fiesta! There will be several stages with performances at the same time in the different parts of the venue. Dates: December 28-30 (12:00-20:30), December 31 (15:00-5:00 on January 1) You can choose between one day ticket (different price on the last day), two day ticket, three day ticket and four day ticket. Please note that the tickets are limited and may get sold out quickly. The countdown events are not open for children.
strTitle: Get a ticket for the best New Year Countdown concerts!

strIntroduction: Matsuyamachi is located in Chuou-ku, Osaka. They sell popular Japanese snacks, toys, Japanese dolls, fireworks, and many more. <Tour Schedule> We'll pick-up by car at your hotel in Osaka. If have some group reservations, we will drive around a bit to pick everyone up, and drive to our destination, Matsuyamachi.  You can enjoy shopping for 2 hours from 9:00am. to 11:00am.  Finally, we'll take you to Namba Takashimaya (department store) at 11:15am.
strTitle: Kawaii Japanese Shopping Tour at Matsuyamachi

strIntroduction: I believe that having a meal at a local home is the best way to learn about the cultures of a country. Come visit my home in Kobe located 1 hour train ride from Osaka and 1.5 hour train ride from Kyoto, and let's have a Japanese home party! I will pick you up at the nearest station (JR Rokkomichi station) and take you to my apartment which will be a 2 minute walk. Then, we will go to a Japanese supermarket to shop for ingredients. I will give you some tips how to choose for the right ingredients for Japanese cooking. After that, we will cook a Japanese cuisine! We'll have the food as lunch or dinner after cooking. <Schedule> Pick-up at the station  Shopping for ingredients (30 min)  Cooking (50 min)  Eating (40 min) Please choose ONE menu from the list below: -Japanese Hotpot (meat, seafood, vegetables, rice...) -Okonomiyaki (meat, vegetables. flour...) -Chawanmushi (egg, vegetables...) and Takikomigohan (steamed rice with vegetables) -Ozouni (ricecake, vegetables...) -Chirashi-sushi (rice, sashimi, egg, vegetables...) -Rolled-sushi (rice, seaweed, vegetables, fish) -Udon (meat and flour) -Wagyu Steak (beef vegetables...)Please pay additional money for this option. If you have other suggestions what you want to make, please let me know! In this case, I may ask you to bring additional money on the day. I can also arrange vegetarian menus if you request.
strTitle: Learn Japanese Homestyle Cooking in Kobe!

strIntroduction: 5 minutes away from Toro Nature Center . Visitors who come to JR Toro Station will be picked up. After filling in the necessary documents at the reception, we will give you safety instructions. When you're ready we will move to the Red-crowned Crane House. In the Red-crowned Crabe House you will easily learn more about the cranes from the various materials available. Finally we will go to see the cranes. The exact observation point on the day will be determined by the guide. Then we will return to Toro Nature Center and end the tour. It will leave excitement and lots of memories, and you will want to return again one day. Duration: about 4 hours Held between: November to February Tour departs schedule morning 9:30 to 13:30 (at least two people, prior reservations required) Set: Toro Nature Center JR Toro Station, there is free pick-up Elementary school students can also participate. If you are coming to JR Toro Station, please use 9.05 Kushiro Station departure, 9.36 Toro Station arriving. ~ 14.39 Toro Station departure, 15.09 Kushiro Station arriving.
strTitle: Japanese red-crowned crane observation tour in Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: You will have a training experience in the mountain village where our Shinobi folks train themselves. <Day 1> - Morning: Meet in Tokyo at your hotel. Visit Asakusa. Lunch is not included in the price. - Afternoon : Visit the Jidai Academy Dojo. Learn Shuriken and Blowgun. - Night: Transfer to Akiruno City. Lodge at Ninja-Samurai Mountain Retreat. <Day 2> - Breakfast and Supper: Self-catering at the retreat. - Morning: Japanese language study. After, Ninjutsu lecture and Bojutsu lesson. - Lunch: Dine out. - Afternoon: Learn Taijutsu. - Night: Lesson on Jutte and Bachi (baton). <Day 3> - Breakfast and Supper: Self-catering at the retreat. - Morning: Zen meditation. Then, participate in a local community activity in the forest. - Afternoon: Field running. - Night: Go to Onsen (Hot Spring). - About Meditation The art of Ninjutsu is more than learning the physical skills of the martial arts. It is also about finding your inner self through physical conditioning, meditation, and discipline. With the practice of meditation one develops key elements of increased awareness and detachment while increasing his/her sense of inner peace. <Day 4> - Breakfast and Supper: Self-catering at the retreat. - Morning: Japanese language study. Then, Ninjutsu lecture and lesson on Hojojutsu and Kusarigama. - Lunch: Dine out. - Afternoon: Kenjutsu (sword practice). - Night: Ninja Mountain Trekking throughout the night. <Day 5> - Morning: Time to rest after overnight ninja mountain trekking. - Lunch: Self-catering. - Afternoon (until 3pm): Review Shuriken and Kunai. In the martial arts training, you'll learn: 1. Bojutsu - A Japanese martial arts style that focuses on training with a bo staff. 2. Taijutsu - Taijutsu refers to any techniques involving unarmed combat or the development of natural human ability - a vital area of practice in ninjitsu. 3. Shuriken - A hand-held weapon, considered to be a secret weapon. Throwing one at an opponent is meant to create confusion or a temporary nuisance, allowing the thrower to assume a more assertive position. 4. Kunai - A dagger-like multi-purpose utensil, used for digging, breaking, climbing, attacking, etc. 5. Kusari Fundo - A hand held weapon used in feudal Japan, consisting of a length of chain (kusari) with a weight (fundo) connected to each end of the chain. 6. Battojutsu/Kenjutsu - Literally meaning "Sword Technique," pertains to techniques that entail the use of swords. The program is subject to change depending on local weather, local events etc. There's a possibility of changing the orders of the training.
strTitle: 5-Day Ninja Immersion in a Ninja Village House in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Ishikawa prefecture's Kanazawa city is rich in cultural traditions, history and unique local art, crafts and delicacies. The city's relative proximity to Shirakawa-go, Takayama and Kyoto makes it very accessible for travelers. Furthermore, the Shinkansen will connect Tokyo to Kanazawa directly in just 2.5 hours from March 2015! Kanazawa city was established around a shrine and a farmer market, but quickly developed into one of Japan's richest and biggest cities during the Maeda feudal clan rule in the Edo period. Kanazawa's most famous art and craft is the gold leaf production, whose history dates back to 16th century and has been well preserved today. On this full day private tour you will visit some of the city's highlights guided by a local expert who will tell you everything about the rich history and culture of Kanazawa. The following is an example of the itinerary which can be customized according to your preferences (the order of the places visited can be changed): 1. Kenrokuen: one of the three most beautiful Japanese gardens in the country (the other two being Korakuen in Okayama and Kairakuen in Mito, Ibaraki prefecture). The stone lanterns are an iconic symbol of Kanazawa city. 2. Kanazawa Castle: unique remaining white gateway with spacious gardens. 3. Nagamachi samurai district: the former samurai district with narrow alleys and well preserved residences. 4. Higashi-chaya geisha district: one of Kanazawa's highlight and very well preserved area with many geisha houses that are still practicing. Nearby you can visit the famous gold leaf shops. 5. Omicho market: one of the largest fresh food markets during the Edo period. 6. 21st Century Museum of Contemporary Art: a unique building with attractive modern art exhibitions. Don't forget to try some local sweets like rakugan or choseiden which are typical for Kanazawa!
strTitle: Explore the city of samurai Kanazawa in a full day tour!

strIntroduction: We use ingredients from the local Kamakura Farmers Market. Kamakura vegetables are famous for being used in high-end restaurants in Tokyo. You can easily learn how to cook Authentic Japanese dishes or Vegetarian dishes. We would like you to deliver our real Japanese cuisine and Japanese homemade dishes to your families and friends after class when you return home. We have 3 kinds of courses you can choose from. <Authentic Japanese Home Cooking> 1 main dish 2 side dish 1 miso soup 1 choice of Japanese white rice or brown rice <Authentic Japanese Shoujin Cuisine (Vegetarian option)> 1 main dish 2 side dish 1 sumashi soup 1 choice of Japanese white rice or brown rice <Healthy Cooking Regimen> You can arrange the menu according to your diet, and make it healthy! For example; - no wheat - no-egg - against fatty liver syndrome - gluten-free Here are a few example of main dishes that you can choose from: -Maki-zushi -Nori-maki -Oyako-don -Shouga-yaki -Ton-jiru -Tenpura -Okonomi-yaki -Sukiyaki -Zou-sui Duration will be 2-3 hours. Please let me know the following info when you make the booking; -Name of each participant -Food allergies -Nationality -Email address -------------------------------------------- About Japanese Cuisine... Kamakura Shojin cuisine is the origin of Japanese Cuisine. At first glance, the Shoujin Cuisine appears simple and plain. However you will be amazed by the high selection of seasonal ingredients, their careful preparation, the complex cooking methods, and the delicate and beautiful presentation. This traditional cuisine has been handed down to the present day. These principles are the foundations of Japanese cooking (including shoujin cuisine) and are also the foundations of present-day kaiseki ryori.
strTitle: Enjoy a Japanese Cooking Class at a Local Home in Kamakura

strIntroduction: Come to our salon and dress up in a kimono! We have a variety of kimonos ready for you, and I'm sure you will find you favorite. First when you come to our salon, we will have you choose a kimono of your preference, and also choose your favorite hairstyle from our catalog. We also lend pretty hair accessories, so please coordinate! You will then move to the room next doors, and we will help you wear the kimono and do your hair. We will also fix your makeup if requested. This will take about an hour or more. After you are all dressed up, you are ready to go take a walk outside! Right outside our salon is the famous Nagoya Castle. I recommend that you tour the Nagoya Castle in your kimono. There is also a shopping place called Osu, and you may be able to find some nice souvenirs. Walking time is 2 hours. You can come back early when you are done. Please come back to our salon to undress, which will take another 30 min. The salon is open from 10am to 5pm, but since we allow guests to walk outside, available starting times are from 10am to 1pm. We have kimonos for both men & women, so anyone is welcome! Age & height requirements: - Guest must be 13 years old or older. - We have kimonos that fit people from 140cm up to 200cm. I am sorry but if you are lower than 140cm or higher than 200cm, the kimono will not fit you.
strTitle: Dress Up in a Traditional Kimono and Walk Around Nagoya!

strIntroduction: Yoshino River is one of Shikoku island's longest rivers, crossing all of its 4 prefectures. The most scenic part of Yoshino River is located deep into the mountains of Tokushima prefecture in Iya Valley. Centuries ago it was used as a hiding place for rebels against the ruling clan. The picturesque jagged, white rocks of Oboke and Koboke gorges took over 200 million years to be created by the rapid stream of Yoshino River. Presently, the river is one of the best place to experience outdoor activities in Japan. It is well known for river rafting, but this tour gives you also the option to try the challenge of canyoning along a secluded gorge! The canyoning offered does not require you to be fit; instead you should be ready to slide down waterfall chutes, jump into water pools, hang on a zipline and many more! Rafting will surely thrill you and you will be encouraged to scream in excitement as loud as you can every time the raft shakes over the swirling rapids! Don't be afraid to fall into the water - it's part of the fun! This tour is offered by qualified professionalists, among which is the Australian managing director who was so mesmerized by the beauty of Yoshino River that he decided to live there permanently. You will be given detailed instructions and equipment, so don't worry if you've never tried outdoor activities before. Yoshino River is the ideal place to start!
strTitle: River rafting and canyoning in Yoshino River, Shikoku

strIntroduction: One of the magnificent views in Japan is Iwafune shrine, which is located in a bunch of rocks. Due to its location, to get to the top of the shrine is on the hard roads. So we highly recommend you to wear comfortable shoes and clothes to go to the Iwafune shrine. You will also take a walk on a suspension bridge that is called 'Hoshi-no-buranko' which literally means 'swings of the stars'. It is because this bridge is so high that it feels like you can touch the stars, which means 'Hoshi' in Japanese. You will enjoy the beautiful view from the sky! Detailed itineraries: 10:00 Kintetsu Kyoto station  Suspension bridge called 'Hoshi-no-buranko'  11:30 Iwafune Shrine  15:00 Kintetsu Kyoto station Join this tour and make your trip unforgettable! strIntroduction: Utoro is the largest and only sizable town along the western coast of the Shiretoko Peninsula. Located at the entrance to the national park, it serves as a transportation hub and is the boarding point for sightseeing boat tours up the peninsula's coast. In this tour, you will visit Utoro and see the white ocean that is covered by ice. You can even walk on the ice! During the winter, it is extremely cold, however, you can see the white ocean only in the winter season! So don't miss this opportunity to visit Utoro! Detailed itineraries: There are three tours per day: at 10:00, 13:30 and a sunset tour at around 15:00 Each tour takes about an hour and a half. strIntroduction: This is a great opportunity to visit not only the main attractions but also some of the lesser know places to enjoy this amazing time of year in Kyoto. We can take in the stunning beauty of nature as it blends gracefully with it's surrounding buildings. This is an experience that will give you a deeper appreciation of nature and of the Zen arts. As a guide with a deep interest in the history and culture of Japan, I will also be happy to share my knowledge with you about the temples, the religion, culture and tips on things to do after the tour. As this tour is an exclusive private tour, we can adjust for what works best for your group. This tour runs from Nov 15th-Dec 10th, 2014. Please understand that the leaves are only at their peak for a week or two, and as a result we might have to do some "hunting" and change the itinerary or rent a car to go into the mountains to get the real experience. Regardless, even if you don't see the leaves in their peak, you will still find it to be an experience you will remember for years to come.

strIntroduction: A sun pillar is a vertical shaft of light extending upward or downward from the sun. Typically seen during the sunrise or sunset, sun pillars form when the sunlight reflects off the surfaces of falling ice crystals associated with thin, high-level clouds (like cirrostratus clouds). In this tour, you will go to Lake Masshu in order to see the sun pillar. A sun pillar is a phenomenon that appears only during the winters in the early morning. You may not be able to see a sun pillar at Lake Masshu, however, there is a high possibility that you can see it! Detailed itineraries: 8:00 Meet up at Mashuu station, and visit Lake Masshu  10:00 Lake Kussharo  14:00 Depart at nearest station that will be good access to your next destination Join this tour and make your trip unforgettable! strIntroduction: Reflexology is a type of massage used to relieve the tension in the body and to treat illness, based on the theory that there are reflex points on the feet, hands and head linked to every part of the body. HammockRefle Kikuya is a small salon that offers reflexology in a hammock. A massage while you are resting on the hammock is unique, but it sure will make you feel comfortable. HammockRefle Kikuya is the first salon that provided reflexology in a hammock in Japan! Detailed courses: A) HammockRefle 30 minutes course B) HammockRefle 45 minutes course Don't miss this chance to try hammock reflexology!

strIntroduction: Asakusa Asakusa is one of the most traditional places in all of Tokyo. You will experience the proper way to visit the temple and shrine! strIntroduction: Ama is a Japanese word for Japanese divers who go undersea to collect abalone, spiny lobster and other seafood. A majority of the Ama's are women, and they do not dive with the air tanks, but simply with a mask. They are very traditional divers and are able to go deep into the ocean for a long time. In this tour, you can meet an Ama at their hut located by a nostalgic seaside village in Oosatsu, located in Toba City. Oosatsu is an area that has been playing an important and specific role to offer seafood to Ise-Jingu shrine for over 2000 years. The Oosatsu village is characterized by its distinctive life based on fishery and deep worship for the sea deities. In the hut, the Ama divers will provide you with fresh seafood, folklore dances, and interesting talks. You can ask them questions on their daily life, or about Toba city in general. After your stay at the Ama hut, you can go visit other attractive spots in Toba city! Here is the Itinerary of the tour: Meet at Kintetsu Toba station Move to Oosatsu to visit Ama hut Seafood meal for lunch Visit Ama Museum Visit Ishigami-san shrine Visit Cafe & souvenior shop Gozaya Return to Toba station It is really rare to get to meet an Ama and to talk with them! Don't miss this opportunity to explore another important culture of Japan!
strTitle: Ama Culture Experience At a Nostalgic Seaside Village

strIntroduction: Shizuoka City has a lot of places to visit and enjoyed. Not only a great view of Mt. Fuji but you can see the beautiful nature and learn Japanese history and culture. In this tour, well visit one of the historical sites, Kunozan Toshogu and if the weather allows you will see a magnificent view of Mt. Fuji and enjoy the taste of Sushi at Shimizu port where is the No.1 catch of tuna in Japan. The tour will be 5 hours, but you can choose other places than the above depending on your interest or request to make 6, 7 or 8 hour-tour. Ill come up with a plan for you if you let me know.  Kunozan Toshogu Shrine The shrine is one of the most popular sightseeing spots in Shizuoka City. The main building was designated as a national treasure in 2010. It is worth seeing. The shrine is dedicated to the first Shogun, Tokugawa Ieyasu, who was the founder of the Edo government. You may find out Ieyasu Tokugawas message of peace if you visit there. We can visit the shrine by 5-minute ride of an aerial gondola.  Nihondaira Hill A panoramic view of the port, Miho pine grove and Mt. Fuji can be enjoyed from Nihondaira, if the weather allows. Tea picking experience is available from the end of April through October at Nihondaira Ochakaikan. It will be a good experience as well.  Sushi museum is located in the shopping mall facility, S-Pulse Dream Plaza at Shimizu Port attracting many people from home and abroad. After learning about Sushi, you can enjoy the authentic sushi there, because there are many sushi restaurants gathering in the facility.
strTitle: Visit of Shoguns Shrine Toshogu & Sushi Lunch

strIntroduction: If you want to participate in refreshing summer activities during your stay in Hokkaido, we recommend you visit Niseko! Niseko is located in western Hokkaido, an island in northern Japan, surrounded by Mountain Yotei, Niseko-Annupuri and other beautiful mountains. The average annual temperature in Niseko is as low as 6.3. During the winter, the northwest monsoon brings moisture from the sea, producing heavy snowfalls when hitting the mountains. The deepest snow accumulation of the year is about two meters! The area turns into a winter wonderland, attracting ski and snowboarders from around the world, as the snow is soft and powdery. Even without the snow, Niseko attracts hikers who goes trekking in the cool summer weather. Here are the courses we offer: 1. Half Day Course Mt. Shirakaba/Lake Kagami/Onuma,etc Season: June ~Beginning of October Required Time: 3 hours Starting Time: Morning Course 8:30- / Afternoon Course 13:30- **Please arrive 15 minutes prior to the starting time. Minimum No. of participants: 2 person 2. One day Course Iwaonupur/ChisenupuriAnnupuri,etc Season: June ~Beginning of October Required Time: 6 hours Starting Time: 9:00 **Please arrive 15 minutes prior to the starting time. Minimum No. of participants: 2 person 3. Traverse Course Lake Shinsen~Goshiki Hot spring, etc Season: June to Beginning October (Except for August) Required Time: 7 hours Starting Time: 9:00 **Please arrive 15 minutes prior to the starting time. Minimum No. of participants: 2 person Why We Love It: - Enjoy the various scenery in Niseko! - Refresh your body and mind in the nature! - Safe tour with experienced and qualified guide(s). Come to Niseko this summer and make your trip entertaining and unforgettable!
