strIntroduction: This is an unique experience in which you will learn about the Japanese culture at night, through the kimono fashion show, temple/shrine visits, Japanese sake tasting, and Japanese music! The tour will take place in Kagurazaka, Tokyo! At night, Akagi Jinjya will light up, and will host many fun events for you to experience the Japanese culture! Here is a detailed schedule of the event! 1. You will visit the Akagi Shrine and will see the shrine maiden perform dances and music. 2. You will try Japanese sake and will be able to purchase them if you like the taste of it! 3. You will see a Kimono fashion show that uses kimono fabric from an old kimono. A Hair, makeup show will be included as well! 4. Watch a band with Japanese traditional instruments perform! You will be able to rent a Yukata, and someone will help you wear it. Your hair and make up will also be done by free! There will be a lot of locals at this event as well! Meet with the locals and learn more about the Japanese culture! Don't miss this one time event! Event time and place: 2014. September 6th (Saturday) from 17:00-20:30 at Akagi Jinjya
strTitle: Experience the Japanese Culture at Night, Sep 6th

strIntroduction: I am a bilingual, born and raised in Tokyo. I know where to eat great food, where to get drunk, and where to sing, and where to dance. Basically, I know how to have the most fun in Tokyo! As long as you let me know what you like in terms of food and activities (such as singing or dancing, socializing or watching shows) in advance, I will plan your night from dinner all the way to the end of the night, and I will take you out to show you how exciting Tokyo's nightlife is along with my friends. Here is an example of one exciting night that I spent with a couple of people from Europe! The couple asked me to take them out to a Japanese restaurant that I like; they did not specify a particular cuisine as they had no idea, and they wanted a local to choose for them. What they also asked for was a typical Japanese night out -- what most Japanese people do after they have dinner with their friends on a Friday night. So, I reserved a restaurant that cooks food using hay -- it is quite a performance -- got some friends, and we ordered seared bonito, vegetables, and many other Japanese dishes with Japanese sake that we chose for them. As for the sake, we started out with some light sweet ones, and eventually got some strong ones. We explained to the couple about each dish, and we had a great dinner as we talked about everything from Japanese culture to politics and history. After dinner, we went to karaoke. We all sang a lot and drank even more, and we also sang them some Japanese songs while explaining to them about the band. We stayed out until 3:00 am, and after that, we told the cab driver where to take the couple back, and sent them off. We had a blast together, and we became really good friends. This is just an example. I would like to emphasize the fact that, I am here to have fun with you. There is a lot more to do in Tokyo than to just go see, and it is always much more fun when you have locals with you. So, I want to make sure that during your stay in Tokyo, you have a great time, not only sightseeing, but also eating and drinking!
strTitle: Spend an Exciting Night Out in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: In Mie prefecture, there is a temple located in a mountainous area, which is rarely visited by people. This temple is different from many other temples because it is supported and maintained by parishioners. Many of the locals who love this temple, and the priest takes care of this nice, peaceful temple. The priest has an experience of working as a priest in Washington, USA, so he is very friendly with foreign people. He is also kind enough to share his time to talk with you! Tour Details: 1) Sutra reciting (English version of Sutra will be given to you) 2) Zazen session, while listening to the natural water fall and feeling the cool breeze 3) Priest talk 4) Green tea and Japanese confectionery will be served. 5) Walking tour in the precinct of the temple Be sure not miss the main pond and garden which was made during the Heian period! Come visit us in this wonderful, peaceful temple, where a friendly priest will welcome you!
strTitle: Experience Zen Practice at a Tranquil Temple in Mie

strIntroduction: Flower arrangement, called Ikebana in Japanese, is one of Japan's three biggest and famous culture. Through Ikebana, people feel the beauty of plain nature. Simplicity is the key to Ikebana, with a relaxed mind and peaceful heart. In this experience, I will explain the history of flower arrangements. Afterwards, you will learn how to arrange the flowers. Here is the schedule. --Schedule-- - Explain the history of flower arrangement (Ikebana) (25minutes) - Experience flower arrangement (50minutes) - Appreciate the your flower arrangement (15minutes) If you want to learn more about the Japanese culture, or want to challenge something new, sign up for this Ikebana class! You will learn more about the beauty of plain nature, and how it is like to focus on something with a relaxed, peaceful mindset! Availability : Monday to Friday, after 18:30 All day during the Weekends
strTitle: Experience Ikebana, a Flower Arrangement Class!

strIntroduction: Hakone is part of the Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park, located less than 100 kilometers away from Tokyo. Come enjoy the beautiful wilderness in Hakone! Photos by: https://flic.kr/p/dvgPpn https://flic.kr/p/eLXQ17 https://flic.kr/p/4zo7bD https://flic.kr/p/idwbmQ https://flic.kr/p/hbynnx
strTitle: Go Mountain Biking in Hakone!

strIntroduction: Mount Fuji is the most prominent, highest mountain in Japan. It was registered as a World Heritage Site in 2013, and its beauty and wonder has been admired not only by the Japanese people, but from the people all around the world. This tour will take you to the 5th station of Mount Fuji, and you will climb to the 6th station of Mount Fuji. You will enjoy hiking around the Hoei Crater and Forest line. There are some scars of the eruption on the surface of Mount Fuji, and since the most recent eruption of Mt. Fuji was in 1707, it will be safe for you to walk around the Crater and witness the Crater up close. You will be amazed by the size of the Crater and the energy that is discharged at the top! You will enjoy the nature, get a grip of how it feels to climb a part of Japan's highest mountain and enjoy the view from Mount Fuji. Here is a detailed schedule of the tour: 9:00am : Pick up at the hotels around Lake Kawaguchi area or Kawaguchiko Station 12:00pm : 5th station of Mt. Fuji 6th Station of Mt. Fuji Hoei Crater Forest line of Mt. Fuji 3:00pm-4:00pm : Come back to hotels Why we love it: - Get a grip of how it feels to climb Mt. Fuji! - Feel the nature at Mt. Fuji and the Hoei Crater! - Experience the beauty of the forest line of Mt. Fuji. - Enjoy the view from Mt. Fuji. It will be amazing, and you will never forget this spectacular view! - Feel the rocks or trees that tell you about the eruption of Mt. Fuji. - You will witness the scars of the eruptions as you walk around! - Even if you are a beginner at climbing, don't worry! Anyone can join this tour! - A professional guide will show you around safely with important and interesting information about Mt. Fuji and the Hoei Crater. Join this tour and make your trip unforgettable! Photos by -https://flic.kr/p/9Wcxr -https://flic.kr/p/5NeK5Z -https://flic.kr/p/7XQWUg -https://flic.kr/p/6J7jdo -https://flic.kr/p/aCgjEh
strTitle: Hike Mount Fuji and See the Hoei Crater!

strIntroduction: How refreshing would it be if you could ride the bicycle in the great nature of Niseko? Especially if most of the tour consists of downhills!? For those of you who wants to have a refreshing ride, we have selected various bicycle tours exclusively for you! The tours that we recommend are all private, so that you could enjoy your time freely with your family and friends! Don't miss this opportunity to cycle freely in the nature of Niseko! Niseko is located in western Hokkaido, an island in northern Japan, surrounded by Mount Yotei, Niseko-Annupuri and many other beautiful mountains. The average annual temperature in Niseko is as low as 6.3. During the winter, the northwest monsoon brings moisture from the sea, creating a lot of snowfall when the moisture hits the mountains. The deepest snow accumulation of the year was two meters! Niseko attracts many skiers and snowboarders every year, because of the fine snow, that is soft and powdery. During the summer, Niseko attracts hikers who wants to see the beautiful scenery while hiking in the cool summer weather! Here are the courses we offer! 1. Niseko Rural Districts How about cycling down rural areas? You will enjoy the scenery just like you see on postcards! Required Time: Approx. 3 hours (includes traveling time by car) Length of course: Approx. 15km 2. Niseko Best Spots How about cycling next to the beautiful sunflower fields( in August)?! It is a dream course for photographers!! Required Time: Approx. 3 hours (includes traveling time by car) Length of course: Approx. 17km 3. Niseko Refresh with Speed Start downhill with speed, then change into a relaxing ride in the rural districts... This is our favorite course if you wish for a full day ride! Required Time: Approx. 5 hours (includes traveling time by car) Length of course: Approx. 31km Why We Love It: - Decide the time of when you want to start according to your schedule! Even at 5:00 a.m.!!! - Take rest anytime you wish during the course! - Without a guide! (Don't worry! It is a safe course! A support car will go on ahead and make sure if you are ok!) - Free photos gift!!! - Good for family travelers!!! - Free drinks and snacks in between! Photos by: https://flic.kr/p/fEquiW https://flic.kr/p/njow4G https://flic.kr/p/f44EZw https://flic.kr/p/5beky7 https://flic.kr/p/acts73 https://flic.kr/p/6VbrJG
strTitle: Private Cycling Tour in Niseko, Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: Oze National Park is located in Gunma, which is approximately 150 kilometers north of Tokyo. Oze is Japan's largest highland marsh, and is famous for the rare precious plants and animals that grow and inhabit there. The marsh located in Oze National Park is said to be formed in the Ice Age about 10,000 years ago. Because of the special geographical conditions of the highland basin, plants that evolved in the Ice Age still grow naturally around the park. The beautiful scenery is especially enjoyable when the marsh is covered with blooming skunk cabbage during the spring and with lilies during the summer. You will take a night bus from Tokyo to Oze, and will enjoy hiking at Ozegahara marshland by yourselves. Detailed itineraries: You can choose the departure places from below. 1) Tokyo station 21:30 In front of the Yanma building, Yaesu chuo exit, Tokyo staion 2) Shinjuku station 22:00 In front of Suparu building, West exit, Shinjuku station 3) Ikebukuro station 23:00 1F Sunshine city Bunka kaikan, East exit, Ikebukuro station Arrive at Hatomachi-toge at 5:30 in the early morning Go hiking by yourselves from Hatomachi-toge [Recommended route for the beginners and families] Hatomachi-toge~Ushiku-bunki~Kenkyu-mihonen~ Ushiku-bunki~Hatomachi-toge [Recommended route for the beginners] Hatomachi-toge~Ushiku-bunki~Yoppi suspenstion bridge~Ryugu Crossroad~ Ushiku-bunki~ Hatomachi-toge 14:30 Take a bus at Hatomachi-toge 19:30 Ikebukuro station 20:00 Shinjuku station Why we love it: - You will enjoy the nature of Oze! You will love the unique and beautiful flowers! - Take a deep breathe! You will feel refreshed! -You can escape from the busy city, Tokyo and relax yourself in Oze! - Summer is the best season to go hiking! - Take pictures of the beautiful nature! - The marshland becomes very attractive in late July and early August when the yellow alpine lilies are in bloom!! - Also, the marshland in autumn colors are beautiful in late September and early October when the grasses of the marshland turn bright yellow and red! Don't miss this opportunity to go hiking in Oze! You will never find out about the beautiful nature at Ozegahara unless you visit there! Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/aiYGwD -https://flic.kr/p/aiZKyk -https://flic.kr/p/aiYtqn -https://flic.kr/p/aiYtqn -https://flic.kr/p/aj1y7J -https://flic.kr/p/aj2n4h
strTitle: Go Hiking in Oze & Enjoy the Beautiful Nature!

strIntroduction: If you visit Iriomote Island, you cannot leave without going trekking and canyoning! Join this tour to see the colorful fishes and coral reefs under the clear seawater! Iriomote Island is Okinawa's second largest island. Is it largely undeveloped, and nearly 90 percent of the island is covered by dense jungle and mangrove forests. Most of the forest makes up the Iriomote National Park, which is Japan's southernmost national park. The island's attractions are based around tours to Iriomote Island's abundant nature including sea and river kayaking, canyoning, canoeing, and trekking! This tour offers you with the opportunity to enjoy nature through canyoning and trekking! Detailed itineraries: There are 2 courses you can choose from. A) Waterfall Trekking & Canyoning Course You can enjoy Iriomote's nature by canyoning and waterfall trekking in the jungle. -Canoyoning (40m) -Trekking (50m) -Lunch -Waterfall hiking *Please note that the schedule can change due to the weather conditions. B) Mangrove Canoyoning and Jungle Trekking You can enjoy Iriomote's nature by canyoning and jungle trekking -Canoyoning (1-2h) -Lunch -Trekking (3-4h) *Please note that the schedule can change due to the weather conditions. Why we love it: - You will be amazed by the beautiful waterfall, and the fresh air at Iriomote Island! - Since nearly 90 percent of the island is covered by the dense jungle and mangrove forests, you will enjoy the beauty of nature! - A professional guide will teach you how to do canyoning and trekking! - Beginners are welcome to try canyoning and trekking! - You will never forget the beauty of Iriomote Island! - If you are interested in outdoor activities at Iriomote Island, don't miss this chance! It will be your unforgettable experience! Don't miss this opportunity and make your trip unforgettable! Enjoy the outdoor activities while you explore the nature around you!
strTitle: Go Waterfall Trekking & Canyoning at Iriomote Island!

strIntroduction: Would you want to be a part of the boundless nature scenery? How about going for a walk in the parks of Hokkaido, while feeling the air and smell of the season through the flowers? You may encounter with wildlife creatures during the walk! Hokkaido is the largest and northernmost of Japan's 47 prefectures with many vast areas of untouched nature. Hokkaido enjoys four distinct seasons with no rainy, wet season. In the summer, Hokkaido remains relatively cool with low humidity. In the winter, Hokkaido gets snowy and cold, transforming the mountains into a nice ski and snowboarding district. Here is a list of the tours we offer: - Makomanai Park and Moerenuma Park (~10 km) Go pole walking and refresh your tired body as we walk through these two beautiful parks. - Nohoro Forest Park and Takino Suzuran Hill Park (~10 km) Walk in the forest with rich nature in Sapporo, the capital city of Hokkaido Prefecture. Adorable Hokkaido squirrels may greet you during the walk if you are lucky! - Jozankei Hot Spring District (~10 km) Walk in Jozanei Hot Spring District , known as Sapporos Annex. During this tour, you will explore places for foot or hand bathing, Hot Spring Egg and steamed red-bean cake. Nothing is better than enjoying the hot springs and delicious meal after your long walk! -Kita-Hiroshima Farm (~10 km) Let's enjoy a walk in the farm in a relaxing walking pace! There will be cows, horses and ostriches waiting for you in this dynamic scenery . Why we love it: - The walking course is safe and comfortable for beginners! - You will refresh your body and mind in the greenery. - You will enjoy the various sites in Hokkaido by walking! - You will encounter small inhabitants in the nature! - This tour is safe, with an experienced guide! In Hokkaido, you will have a refreshing experience that is different from being in the big cities such as Tokyo or Osaka! We look forward to go pole walking with you! Photos by: https://flic.kr/p/584798 https://flic.kr/p/hjdive https://flic.kr/p/8RsnSu https://flic.kr/p/8h4cN https://flic.kr/p/K1cdp
strTitle: Go Pole Walking in Sapporo!

strIntroduction: If you visit Miyako island, you cannot leave without going diving or snorkeling! Join this tour to see the colorful fishes and coral reefs under the clear seawater! Miyako Island (Miyakojima), located 300 kilometers south of Okinawa's Main Island and 100 kilometers north of the Yaeyama Islands, is known for some of Japan's best beaches and as a great destination for snorkeling and diving. Many tourists and professional divers visit every year just to go snorkeling or diving at Miyako island, and highly praise the beauty of this ocean and island. Snorkeling and Diving Courses: A) Snorkeling Full Day Course - Go see the coral reefs by boat - Time: 9:00-15:00 - Includes: Snorkel rental, drinks and snacks - Please note that the schedule can change due to weather conditions. - This tour will take place at Yabishi Coral Reef, north of Ikema Island. You will go there by a boat. B) Snorkeling Half Day Course - Go see the coral reefs by boat - Time: 9:00-12:00 - Includes: Snorkel rental - Please note that this course is not available during the Obon holidays. - This tour will take place at Ikema Island, connected to the northwestern corner of Miyako by a bridge. C) Full Day Diving - Includes: Snorkeling, Diving lecture, 1 Beach Dive, Lunch - You will have receive a lecture for beach diving, so beginners are welcome to sign up for this course! - The diving place will be at beach. The price will change depending on number of participants. D) Half Day Diving - Includes: Snorkeling, Diving lecture, 1 Beach Dive - You will have receive a lecture for diving, so beginners are welcome to sign up for this course! - The diving place will be at beach. E) Half Day Diving (Boat Dive) Price is per person and includes: - Diving lecture, 1 Boat Dive - The diving will be boat dive. Why we love it: - Connected to the northwestern corner of Miyako by a bridge, this small island of Ikema, ringed by a scenic coastal road, has fine views above and below the sea. - The Ikema Wetlands in the centre of the island is a wildlife protection area, and home to variety of wild animals such as ducks, egrets, and waders. - You will be amazed by the beautiful beach, corals, and colorful fish at Ikema Island! - A professional guide will teach you how to snorkel and dive! - Beginners are welcome to try snorkeling and diving! - You will never forget the beauty of Ikema Island! - Relax yourself at the Yabishi Coral Reef! - You will see unique shells and tropical fishes! Swim with them in the blue ocean! - The professional guide is aware of the places where you can see many corals, and many caves under the sea, so that you can enjoy more! - You can rent an underwater digital camera for 3000 JPY! This tour will make your trip unforgettable! Join this tour and enjoy the beautiful ocean at Miyako Island! Photos by -https://flic.kr/p/mKU3Q -https://flic.kr/p/mKTZc -https://flic.kr/p/oPs4E -https://flic.kr/p/GPb34 -https://flic.kr/p/Pti41 -https://flic.kr/p/9EtbUt
strTitle: Enjoy Diving and Snorkeling at Miyako Island

strIntroduction: Would you want to be a part of the boundless nature scenery? Wouldn't it be great if you can cycle through the beautiful scenery in Hokkaido while feeling the fresh air and the smell of the season through the flowers? Hokkaido is the largest and northernmost of Japan's 47 prefectures with many areas of untouched nature. Hokkaido enjoys four distinct seasons where there is no rainy, wet season, and the summer remains cool, with low humidity, During the winter, the temperature gets really cold, where many places fall below 32 Fahrenheit or 0 degrees Celsius. Here are the tours we offer for our advanced cyclists: 1. Sapporo, Lake Shikotsuko and Chitose ( 110 km) - Round Trip A challenging course with up-down hills. You will go through green-tree tunnels on the way to Chitose from Lake Shikotsu. This course will be very enjoyable for the advanced cyclists. In Hokkaido, you will definitely have an refreshing experience that is different from traveling around big cities such as Tokyo or Osaka. Come enjoy the different views Hokkaido has to offer as we go cycling! Photo by https://flic.kr/p/egRMur https://flic.kr/p/4jRy7

strIntroduction: In Hokkaido, you will be able to witness the city life and the wilderness, and when visiting Hokkaido, you should not leave without experiencing a day out in the nature! In this tour, you have the opportunity to go sea kayaking at one of Hokkaido's best park! It's a great way to spend your day out in the summer! This tour is for only one group per day! You will be supported by qualified sea kayak guides throughout the day and even if you are a beginner, you will be safe and will be able to enjoy the ride! During the tour, your guide will take you to a lunch spot where only the locals know! You will be able to enjoy this tour on land and on the ocean! Perfect for beginners! - Includes touring the local district with a guide! Hokkaido offers tourists with amazing experiences, through the tasty foods, beautiful nature, and friendly locals. Come visit Hokkaido this summer and go sea kayaking with us! The tour is not available during the winter. strIntroduction: Would you want to be a part of the boundless nature scenery? Would you like to cycle through the dynamic nature of Hokkaido while feeling the fresh air and smelling the season through the flowers? Hokkaido is the largest and northernmost of Japan's 47 prefectures with many areas of untouched nature. Hokkaido enjoys four distinct seasons with no rainy, wet season and remains cool in the summer with low humidity. In the winter, Hokkaido is known to get really cold, with snow fall, turning Hokkaido into a perfect place to go skiing or snowboarding. In this tour, we offer four courses for the intermediate cyclists to enjoy the views of Hokkaido. This cycling tour is safe, as a local guide will be guiding you throughout the day. This tour is also suitable for beginners as the roads are maintained and have smooth asphalt surfaces. Here is a list of tours we have for our intermediate cyclists: - Plate Hill (60km) Many cyclists have always dreamed of cycling on this road. Throughout this cycling journey, you will witness the vast Hokkaido farm. The hill has a lot of colors, like on the artist's palette, changing its color as the season changes. We will be cycling at a speed that suits you best. We tend to go slow so that you can enjoy the scenery. -Naganuma (60km) We will be cycling under the clear blue sky and white clouds, as we go cycling for 60 km through the rural areas of Hokkaido. During the tour, your guide will show you lovely restaurants, which use locally produced Naganuma vegetables. There will also be nice cafes and hot springs which you can stop by. -Naganuma to Hayakita (80 km) In this course, you will enjoy the scenic and pastoral beauty of Hokkaido, while cycling in a rural district, farm and hill. You will have the opportunity to see thoroughbred horses at the northern horse park. -Lake Eniwa (70 km) In this tour, you will be cycling for 70 km in the deep greenery of Lake Eniwa. You will be able to enjoy the beautiful scenery thought the year. You have the option to stop by a famous restaurant for omelets. Hokkaido will definitely offer you a refreshing experience that is different from traveling in big cities such as Tokyo or Osaka. Take this opportunity to see the beautiful views Hokkaido has to offer! Photo by https://flic.kr/p/5bgxZs https://flic.kr/p/71pfGa https://flic.kr/p/59AcPY

strIntroduction: If you are planning to come to Osaka and visit Osaka Castle, why don't you go with the local and have more fun with picnic there? <One day plan> Make a bento box at a Japanese family's home and go for a picnic at Osaka castle, followed by a walk around Osaka Castle Park. For dinner, you will eat Osaka's famous okonomiyaki. When your appetite is fully satisfied, end the night at Spa World for a mega-onsen to heal your body. <Details> Meet at Umeda, Osaka's city central. Make bento boxes at a Japanese family's home. We will start the day with shopping at a local supermarket to buy ingredients. Learn to make Japanese treats such as onigiri and tako-san wiener. After preparing the food, we will visit the famous Osaka castle. Have a delightful picnic while enjoying the view of the beautiful Osaka castle and its luscious greenery. After lunch, you will receive a tour of the castle and visit Japan's tallest building, Abeno Harukas, to buy souvenirs from the famous Tennoji. Next, we will eat Osaka's famous local food - Okonomiyaki. Have fun customizing your own toppings with the guidance of a local Osaka host. After satisfying your appetite, we will go to Spa World to experience a mega-onsen to heal your body. Recently, Sento (a Japanese communal bath house) has gained popularity amongst visiting tourists. You can experience bathing at one of the largest Sento in Japan - the Super Sento. We will end the tour back at Umeda." The tour is available every day. (For scheduling purposes, please book one month in advance)
strTitle: Enjoy picnic at Osaka Castle

strIntroduction: Hakuba is located in the Northern Alps of Nagano Prefecture and it is best known to have Japan's best ski resorts. It can be reached easily from Tokyo (about a 2 hour bullet train ride), and many Japanese people make day trips to Hakuba as they are also known to have great hot spring facilities. During the summer, the snow on the alps melt to transform the ski resort into a beautiful trekking course. We will make your trek entertaining as we point out various birds, such as the Thunder Birds (Ptarmigan) and animals that reside in the alps. We will also guide you to a spot where you can see seasonal flowers and alpine plants. Our trekking course will be full of interesting facts about the mountain and will be a good exercise. Come join our 1 day trekking tour in Hakuba Village in Nagano and enjoy the many scenery the alps offer! We look forward to go trekking with you! Photo Credit: https://flic.kr/p/guGHGn https://flic.kr/p/fJVBka https://flic.kr/p/fFfPyK
strTitle: 1 Day Trekking Tour at the Japan Alps - Nagano/Hakuba

strIntroduction: The Ningyocho neighborhood in Tokyo is known to be a vibrant city with tasty street food and famous traditional restaurant that has been operating for centuries. In Japanese, "Ningyo" means doll, and in the past, this area was a town involved with people such as puppeteers and doll makers. This neighborhood has traditional craft shops, Japanese sweets shops, and many restaurants that offer different kinds of food. It is a neighborhood in which you can experience the culture of Japan through the atmosphere. In this tour, I will guide you through the Ningyocho neighborhood and will show you around to eat downtown local food, which is cheap and delicious! You will be able to drink Sake, eat yakitori, deep fried skewers, local-stew (Nikomi), and many more! Not only will you eat food and drink Sake, you will be able to see the many beautiful sights of the Ningyocho neighborhood and see some traces of old Japan, as there are beautiful shrines and restaurants that have been operating for a long time. Come tour around the Ningyocho neighborhood with me to experience the culture of Japan! This tour will take you out to eat delicious, exceptional food that is not on your tour guide book! I look forward to seeing you! Availability : Monday to Saturday. You can change dates a week before the tour date. Photo credits: https://flic.kr/p/ddE4h https://flic.kr/p/baVurg https://flic.kr/p/dMEQ2n https://flic.kr/p/4kdGFn
strTitle: Local Japanese Food Tour in downtown Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Have you ever gone trekking in the woods at night? The night time may seem like a dangerous time to go trekking, but with a experienced local guide, this night trek will be safe, and a wonderful experience for you! This tour will take you to a different world from daytime, sharpening your sense of smell and sound. This night adventure will require you to go walking in total darkness, where you will learn how to move in darkness by the local guide! The view of the stars will be spectacular, as the darkness of the forest surrounding you will enhance the brightness of the stars that lit above you. By the time you get used to trekking in the darkness, each participant will have time to sit alone, enjoying the nature to themselves. Details about the tour are as follows: Required time: 2 hours Starting time: 18:30 (6 pm) Minimum number of participants: 2 persons Meeting point: Entrance of Maruyama Park ** 5 minutes walk from Maruyama Subway station Age: 3 years and up ( Accompanied by guardian) Why you will love this tour! - Extraordinary and unique experience! - Safe tour with an experienced local guide! - Suitable course for family travelers! - Gain knowledge on wild animals ! - Spiritual experience in the darkness, facing the nature and yourself! - Night hiking under a starlit sky! Come join our night trekking course in Hokkaido! Not only will you be able to star gaze, you will be able to witness wildlife animals that take action during the night time! It will be a fun experience for you! The tour is not available during the winter. Photos by: https://flic.kr/p/d8LMbq https://flic.kr/p/nSghrM https://flic.kr/p/dPucbQ https://flic.kr/p/io2VeF https://flic.kr/p/dUuMeZ
strTitle: Go Night Trekking in Sapporo!

strIntroduction: Osaka is a lively, vibrant city with many things to do! Tours in Osaka generally include visits to Osaka castle, Kaiyukan, Universal Studio, and Umeda Sky Buildingbut there are many more attractive and entertaining spots in Osaka to visit, and these spots are usually known only to the local Japanese people. In this tour, you will visit some historical and local spots that not a lot of tours visit. Osaka has many delicious street foods and has a lot of museums for you to go! Take this opportunity to learn more about the Japanese culture! We look forward to taking you around this amazing city! strTitle: A Half-day Tour for Osaka Geeks!

strIntroduction: Have you ever wondered how your name will be written in Japanese characters? A calligraphy artist will write your name on a Japanese fan using a calligraphy brush. You could challenge yourself to write your name on the fan instead! Please feel free to tell the calligraphy artist if you would like to do so! This Japanese fan will be a great gift to take back home to show your friends and family! The Japanese fan, called Uchiwa is a traditional fan that was originally used as a tool to avert the disasters that were heading towards a certain direction. They were widely used for prayers and rituals. Your name will be written on the Uchiwa and you will be able to take it around everywhere during the hot and humid summer season. Japanese calligraphy, called Shodo is the traditional figurative art of letters, which has been considered as one way of self improvement in Japan. In ancient China, Shodo was worshipped as one of the six major artistic skills. Shodo has now been strongly linked with the Japanese language and has developed into our original, unique culture. I've been engaged in Shodo since I was five years old. She has produced various eye-catching Japanese calligraphy art pieces through the design of movie titles, advertisements and packaging designs, etc. The Shodo pieces designed by her are valued at thousands of dollars. It would be an unforgettable experience for you to meet me and witness the moment she writes your name on the Japanese fan. I will also offer a healing session where she will read your spirits and will try cleansing your aura by using a fan, fragrance, and crystal. The aura that lures around you is like the muscle of the heart. It shapes the way you think, act and behave. If your aura is purified, your mind will be set to think in a positive state and your behavior will start to change. Not only will I get rid of your bad aura, she will give you advice on how you can improve your life. In Japan, we have a traditional belief in the power of words which is called "KOTODAMA". We believe that the spirits inhabit every word and would cause various invisible influences. Green tea and Japanese sweets will be served during your visit. I do not speak fluent English, but there is a translation software available if communication is not possible. In this event, you will be able to experience the many aspects of the Japanese culture, through calligraphy, the Japanese fan, the healing session, the green tea and Japanese sweets, and the atmosphere that is made through my friendly character!
strTitle: Enjoy Calligraphy! Get a Fan with Your Name Written in Kanji

strIntroduction: Halal is an Arabic term that means lawful or permitted. Halal food is food that is allowed under Islamic dietary guidelines. Halal food strictly defines what food is allowed to be consumed and how the food must be prepared. Pork cannot be consumed and other meat that were not slaughtered properly or were dead prior to slaughtering cannot be consumed. When cooking Halal Japanese food, we are not able to use traditional ingredients such as soy sauce, miso, and rice wine (mirin). The demand and attention of Halal food has been growing around the world. We are a Halal certified restaurant, which is really rare around the Kanto area. We have made a Halal Japanese course menu for you to enjoy and learn. We will provide you with thorough information on how to cook the menu, describing each ingredients and steps for you to cook the same course menu when you get back home. After we finish cooking the course menu, we want you to enjoy the meal you just made and enjoy your time with us! Below is the program we have scheduled for you: 1.Tour around Halal Kitchen 2. Introduction to ingredients 3. Making Temaki Sushi, Tempura, Takoyaki 4. Dinner time Come join us to learn how to make a Halal Japanese course menu at a Halal certified restaurant! Share what you learned from us to your friends and family! We look forward to seeing you!
strTitle: Learn How to cook Halal Japanese food.

strIntroduction: This is a calligraphy program to hone your sensibilities. For example when you write the letter "moon," you will become the "moon." You will create a fan in the end of the class. The class will be in Japanese, but not to worry. Words are not important when you are doing calligraphy. You must believe in the concept and feel the meanings at heart, and transmit it into your art. In our program, participants are able to experience shodo by writing the word, "moon", pronounced as Tsu-ki(). Moon is the symbol of maternity that will enhance our emotions of receptiveness and sympathy. The word moon, written by you, shall evoke your internal tenderness and warmth. After the calligraphy session, we will use your shodo piece to make a Japanese paper fan called an "uchiwa". The uchiwa is a Japanese traditional hand tooled paper fan which is used to fan yourself in the hot weather. The uchiwa is one important summer item used to cool ourselves. However, it was originally used in Japanese rituals or prayers to purify and sweep away our life difficulties. Your handmade uchiwa with your own shodo piece will become a very original tool to enhance your spirit. The artist Kashu, who is the lecturer of this program, has been engaged in shodo since she was 5 years old. She has produced various eye-catching Japanese calligraphy art pieces through the design of movie titles, advertisements and packaging designs, etc. The shodo pieces designed by her are valued at thousands of dollars. This would definitely be a once-in-a-lifetime experience, so please come join us! Below is an explanation of calligraphy and zen. ----------------------- Japanese calligraphy, called "shodo/" is a traditional figurative art of letters, which has been considered as one way of self-improvement in Japan. In ancient China, shodo was worshiped as one of the "six major artistic skills" (). (The six major artistic skills are; ethics, literature, mathematics, music, archery and equestrianism. These were the foundations of education for the upper class society). By concentrating our spirit and energy into the soft calligraphy brush, it enables us to develop our moral strength, making us into a stronger individual. In Japan, we have a traditional belief system in the power of words, called "kotodama". We believe that spirits inhabit every word and would cause various invisible influences. Shodo has been strongly linked with the Japanese language and has developed into our original, unique culture.
strTitle: Zen in the Art of Calligraphy

strIntroduction: Do you want to try some outdoor activities in the summer in Hokkaido? This tour will provide you with the opportunity to explore around Toya Lake, and feel summer in Hokkaido! Since this tour is available until October, don't miss this opportunity! Toya Lake, which is located in the southwestern part of Hokkaido, belongs to Shikotsu-Toya National Park. This vast lake has a perimeter of 43 km and in this tour, you will explore around Lake Toya, harvest delicious corns or potatoes, and enjoy the nature and scenery! In this tour, you can explore wherever you want around Toya Lake consulting with a guide, which is private and original tour for your family (group) Why we love it! - Try something different in Hokkaido! - Be amazed by the delicious vegetables grown in Hokkaido! - See the waterfall and feel summer! - Relax yourself with colorful flowers. - Find your original photo spots around Toya Lake! - The professional guide will show you around safely with important and interesting information about Toya Lake! - This tour is totally customized based on your request. This tour is... - 3 hours long. - Available only for one group (One Family) a day. The guide will pick you up around the area of Toya Lake. This tour promises to make your trip unforgettable! Join this tour and enjoy Toya Lake! Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/39Pi9c -https://flic.kr/p/2QZTma -https://flic.kr/p/HwVic -https://flic.kr/p/grQ4r7 -https://flic.kr/p/59iNva -https://flic.kr/p/6BK759
strTitle: Private Customized Tour around Toya Lake in Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: "Enjoy half a day of Stand Up Paddle Board (SUP) Fun around Mt Fuji's Five Lakes and Miho (). Admire the beauty of Fuji as you cruise along the calm glistening lake. We will teach you how to balance and control the SUP. Also expect some fun and games once you become comfortable with standing on the SUP! Location: Fujinomiya City, Shizuoka Meeting place: River Base Meeting time: 8:30 am Stand Up Paddle surfing tour schedule 8:30 Registration, briefing, sign letter of consent 8:45 Change into wet attire 9:15 Transfer to start point 9:35 Warm-up and stretching. Pumping up the SUP 10:00 Brief lesson on how to paddle, held on land 10:10 Paddle in the water on your knees 10:20 Standing up and balancing on an SUP 10:30 Methods of paddling and turning 11:00 Break (Tea or coffee) 11:15 Free & easy cruising 11:40 SUP games: SUP sumo, racing and more 11:55 Free & easy cruising 12:10 End of the tour, returning the SUP 12:40 Arrive back at base, wash up 13:00 End activity"
strTitle: Enjoy Stand Up Paddle around Mt Fuji's Five Lakes

strIntroduction: Let's visit an organic farm in the country and learn about organic farming! People think that Osaka is a huge city with lots of people and skyscrapers, but once you step out of the city center, you will find amazing scenic countryside just a couple of hours away from the city. People living there have a slower life and grow what they eat. In this activity, you will visit an organic farm in Nose, which is a countryside in the north part of Osaka, and learn how to manage the farm with some hands-on practical agriculture work. For lunch, you can learn to cook with seasonal vegetables which grow up in the organic farm. How about visiting the countryside to see untouched nature and think about the source of our daily food? Basic Itinerary: 8:10 Pickup from Umeda station Arrive at Nose Walk through the farm Practical agriculture session 1 Lunch Practical agriculture session 2 Head back to Umeda 17:00 Arrive to Umeda station
strTitle: Experience Organic Farm in Osaka Countryside

strIntroduction: Experience an authentic Japanese tea ceremony held in a traditional house in Kyoto. I will serve you a simple meal with Japanese sake with sweets and Matcha (powdered green tea) at the end. A side dish called Hassun  is eaten together with the sake. This part of the Chaji process is important for the host to exchange greetings and engage in small talk with the guests before having the tea. The number of guests will be kept to a minimal (4 guests maximum) so that we can create an intimate and personal experience for everyone. I invite you to my house where I invite close friends for tea. Please enjoy a bowl of tea together with me. Availability : Wednesday ~ Friday / 2 -5 pm starting time can be flexible.
strTitle: Tea Gathering in a Traditional House

strIntroduction: Gilding is a decorative technique that involves applying fine gold leaves or gold powder onto a solid surface. In this experience, you will learn the art of gilding and decorate a Buddhist altar. Fujii Butsudan was founded in 1855, specializing in restoring Buddhist altars and their fittings. There are many different types of altars such as Kin (gilded) altars for Shin Buddhism, Karaki (foreign wood) altars for Zen Buddhism, compact altars, and modern altars. There are also some custom-made altars. In this tour, you will: Learn about the variety of Buddhist Deities and their different altar styles between sects. Experience gilding techniques used to decorate certain types of altars.
strTitle: Learn the Art of Gilding Gold on Altars

strIntroduction: Yuba (Tofu skin) is a food product made from soybeans. It is widely used in Japanese cuisine. Yuba has a plain but creamy mild flavor. Yubayu specializes in fresh and dry Yuba, using specially selected domestic soybeans that have been cultivated with underflow water from the clear Nagara River. Every morning, experienced and skilled craftsmen manually produce each one of our Yuba sheets using distinctive techniques with time and care. As a Yuba specialty shop, our Yuba products boast a plain but creamy and mild taste and flavor. In this program you can: Observe our Yuba production processes Listen to an explanation about the history and production of Yuba Taste fresh Yuba and some other Yuba products!
strTitle: Observe Yuba (Tofu Skin) Production Process

strIntroduction: If you are looking for something very exciting and exotic, this live Shamisen performance should not be missed! A Shamisen is a traditional Japanese instrument that is made up of 3 strings, played similar to a banjo. This is a show featuring the famous Shamisen performer Kiji, and Japanese traditional dancer Mion, together with the entertainment unit group "Heisei Roman". Enjoy the wondrous acrobatic dances coupled with the romantic harmonies of beautiful music from the Shamisen. It'll be an unforgettable experience and a treat for both your eyes and ears! The theater is located in Ebisu, which is very convenient place. This show is only available on 31st May.
strTitle: Enjoy Live Shamisen Performance in Tokyo, May 31st

strIntroduction: Welcome to our cooking class, where you can learn traditional Japanese cooking in English! Are you dissatisfied with just eating delicious Japanese food? Looking for a unique experience to enhance your trip to Japan? Always wanted to learn how to cook traditional Japanese home dishes? Join our cooking class, and be able to recreate authentic Japanese food when you return home from your trip to Japan! Our class is conveniently located right next to Tsukiji fish market, so the ingredients used are the freshest yet, straight from the market! There will also be a Japanese/English interpreter to help translate all instructions so that you can easily understand the steps. Take a stop at our class to add a little something different to your sightseeing journey in the city. We look forward to welcoming you!
strTitle: Learn How to Cook Japanese Cuisine at Tsukiji Fish Market
